title: Maintenance Technician II
description:
**Job Overview**



For more than 70 years, Heatherwood has been committed to building upscale residential rental communities, commercial properties, and luxury urban spaces. Our commitment to quality constructions, striking designs, and providing exemplary service, makes us one of the most highly regarded leaders in the industry. Additionally, we offer a competitive benefits package including health & dental, and vision insurance, 401(k), and paid PTO.

  



Heatherwood is on a mission to create high-quality places that inspire a genuine sense of community. As a Maintenance Technician II for Heatherwood, you are the driving force in providing great service to our residents in a fast-paced, challenging, and rewarding environment.

  


**What you bring to Heatherwood:**


* A positive attitude
* Reliability and dependability
* Team first approach to everyday
* Willingness to learn new tasks.
* A customer-first approach to providing world-class maintenance and service.
* Ability to take direction from a supervisor and work independently through task completion.
* Commitment to completion of time-sensitive tasks.
* Computer and smartphone skills required.
* Effective written and verbal communication.
* Ability to work independently and complete assigned tasks.
* Safe understanding of hand/power tools and use of PPE (Personal Protective Equipment)
* Flexibility to work overtime and weekends.
* Attention to detail and consistently doing the job right the first time.


* Valid driver's license.

  


**Your Responsibilities:**


* Apply a “Safety First” approach to every day at Heatherwood.
* A minimum experience of 2+ years of multifamily residential, commercial, or hotel maintenance, or similar experience.
* Maintain the property's interior and exterior standards.
* Openness and approachability to feedback and consistent communication
* Understanding and experience with the following mechanical systems, but not limited to: HVAC equipment, plumbing (water heaters, drain clearing, fixture replacement, and repair), minor electrical repair, appliance repair, drywall prep and repair, painting, and carpentry.
* Knowledge of building systems including fire sprinklers, fire alarms, and central mechanical/HVAC systems
* Solid understanding of general building maintenance, work order management, and apartment make-ready process.
* Ability to effectively troubleshoot and problem-solve maintenance issues.
* Shared responsibility of “On-Call” schedule with your property and other Heatherwood property teammates.
* Job responsibility requires standing for extended periods, walking, pushing, lifting up to 50 pounds, bending and reaching, kneeling, stooping, crawling, and climbing.



This list is an example of the Tech II responsibilities but is not an all-inclusive list of job descriptions. Business needs will dictate additional responsibilities.

  


**Your Development:**


* Heatherwood Safety Culture – monthly team safety training
* CPR certification required at locations with Level 4 Pool Supervision Requirements
* How your success in maintenance contributes to the community's goals
* How to effectively manage your time and communicate in a fast-paced setting.
* Pool and Spa training. Support in obtaining CPO (Certified Pool Operator) certificate.
* HVAC training and support in obtaining HVAC Universal License.



Ongoing maintenance training and development and internal company growth opportunities.

title: Account Supervisor
description:
For more than 70 years, Heatherwood has been in the business of developing, redeveloping, and managing quality apartment communities in the New York region. Heatherwood is one of New York’s leading development companies in luxury residential communities, commercial properties, and luxury urban spaces with a portfolio that spans from Brooklyn and Queens to the east end of Long Island. Heatherwood currently owns and operates thousands of apartments and employs approximately 250 associates.

  



The Accounts Supervisor will report to the Community Manager and will provide clerical and administrative services to ensure efficient, timely, and accurate payment of accounts under their control. A person in this position must possess superior organizational, attention to details and excellent communication skills.

  


**Responsibilities and Duties**


* Process manual rent deposits and payments.


* Process and review electronic payments.


* Review new leases, renewal leases, and manage 3rd party subsidy agencies.


* Responsible for execution of final billing and apartment damage charges.


* Process monthly late charges to resident account.


* Research and resolve payment discrepancies.


* Handle escrow security deposits and refunds.


* Perform account reconciliations.


* Support our legal team by providing monthly unpaid charge reports to initiate rent demands.


* Research and resolve ledger discrepancies directly with customers.


* Assist and support customers with resident portal. This includes but is not limited to creating accounts, account management, and technical support both in person and over the phone.


* Comply with any state and/or city-required mandates.


* Achieve financial objectives through rent collection by carrying out billing, collection, and reporting activities according to specific deadlines.


* Address and resolve customer account concerns in a timely and professional manner; ensuring a level of service that results in high customer loyalty and satisfaction.


* This position is a resident/customer facing position which will require the associate to field walk in resident questions.


* Help and support leasing consultants to achieve sales goals by assisting with the leasing process.


* The Account Supervisor position will be located on site.

  


**Qualifications**


* YARDI Voyager, RentCafe, and SuiteSpot experience preferred.


* Payment processing experience required.


* Proficient in Microsoft Office.


* Professional verbal and written communication skills.


* Strong attention to detail.


* Time management and problem-solving skills.


* Bilingual is a plus.


* Exposure to revenue, profit and loss statement, and budget management a plus.


* Minimum of 2-3 years of Property Management experience required.

  


**Education**


* Bachelor’s degree in related field required.

title: Supportive Housing Entitlement Coordinator
description:
**\\*$500 Sign-on Bonus!\\***


**Options for Community Living, Inc. is looking for a Supportive Housing Financial Entitlement Coordinator to join our team!** An ideal candidate should meet the following requirements:


* Must meet standards for designation as Qualified Mental Health Staff (QMHS).
* Bachelor’s degree\\* in human service-related discipline, or in a mental health discipline, or certified or licensed as a Social Worker.
* At least three years of experience working with persons with psychiatric disabilities, homelessness, HIV/AIDS, chemical dependency, or other chronic conditions.
* Excellent writing skills, time management, organization and assessment abilities are required.
* Valid driver’s license, clean driving record, valid auto insurance, and access to a vehicle is required.


* An alternative combination of experience, education and credentials may be substituted for educational requirements.

  




**Our Company Benefits include:**


* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* Generous PTO: 5 Wellness Days, 10-22 Vacation Days, 8 Sick Days, 11 Paid Holidays - yearly
* 403(b) retirement plan with an employer match
* Employee Assistance Program
* Tuition Assistance
* Wellness Initiatives
* Paid Training & On-the-Job Training
* Promotional Opportunities
* Mileage reimbursement
* Life Insurance
* Flexible Spending Account

  


**Salary Range:**



$45,500/yr. ($25.00/hr.) - $58,240/yr. ($32.00/hr.).


*Salary offers will be commensurate with experience and other qualifications.*

  


**Schedule****:**



Monday - Friday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM, 8:30 AM – 4:30 PM or 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM (35 hours/week)

  


**Location** **-** In-person based out of our Ronkonkoma and Hempstead offices, with field visits required

  


**Pay Type:** Non-exempt

  


**Responsibilities:**



The Financial Entitlement Coordinator provides assistance to the Financial Entitlement Supervisor with the oversight of the Supportive Housing Program in Nassau and Suffolk County regarding initial and ongoing financial matters. The Financial Entitlement Coordinator acts as a liaison between the Intake Department, program staff, and the financial department to ensure accurate documentation and timely submission of all financial documents and ensure the program rent is paid on time.


* Accompany and train staff and residents on entitlement agencies (DSS/SSA). Apply/ recertify for benefits as well as any emergency assistance applications with clients.
* Provide on site assistance at Supportive housing and licensed sites to assist with financial matters, along with driving residents to various financial appointments.
* Develop proficient knowledge for all programs under the Social Security Administration, Department of Social Services, trust companies, rep-payee regulations, and OMH/ HUD financial regulations.
* Oversee accounts for Options representative payee accounts to ensure no excess income and rep-payee spending guidelines are followed. Assist with applying for representative payees.
* Work with clerical and financial staff on development and processing of initial leases, sub leases, completion of the process requirements for annual re-certifications, interim re-certifications, unit transfers and annual rental worksheets.
* Assist HUD program with annual recertifications, collection and processing of documents.
* Assist clients and staff with obtaining annual recertification documents.
* Assist with maintaining benefits by helping residents and staff complete necessary applications, recertifications and the submission of all required documentation.
* Serve as a support for Program Supervisors, provide availability to answer questions regarding benefit and entitlement concerns under the guidance of the Financial Entitlement Supervisor.
* Monitor the monthly rents, reoccurring arrears, delinquent accounts, develop budgets as needed. Ensure Personal needs allowance is provided for applicable programs.
* Maintain and update the weekly grid for the supportive housing program.
* Process rent adjustments in accordance with established procedures, including obtaining verifications, entering information into computer, etc.
* Assist intake department for all new move ins financial documents.
* Attend new resident move ins and completes necessary documentation for Medicaid, HEAP, SSA, PA and changing addresses as needed. Ensures all benefits are secured timely.
* Maintain effective communication regarding all resident’s accounts with Program Supervisors and Financial Entitlement Supervisor in addition to other agency departments.
* Assist program staff to ensure Medicaid and all other benefits are maintained.
* Conduct quarterly audits of licensed financial binders.
* Establish relationships with the Department of Social Services to communicate regarding financial matters.
* Attend fair hearing and accompany residents and staff. Assist in thorough preparation of documentation and preparation by all participants.
* Facilitate conversations with residents who are in arrears, and work with residents and program to develop interventions to have arrears paid in full.
* Develop a training program to train staff on all aspects of finances.
* Conduct quarterly financial training and individualized training as needed.
* Assist with new hire training.
* Other relevant tasks as assigned by management.
company_description: Options is committed to providing high quality housing & services for vulnerable Long Islanders. Our well-trained staff provide timely person-centered services in an effective & compassionate manner.

title: Remote HRIS Support Specialist - Tier 1
description:
***Role and Responsibilities:***



The ideal candidate must be a quick learner with technical aptitude skills. In this role, HRIS support and guidance will be provided to our clients:


* Provide client support for the HRIS system
* Serve as point of contact for HRIS products. Assist’s Team with maintaining data integrity, configuration changes and testing.
* Research, troubleshoot and resolve system issues with Client.
* Participate in HR projects involving future HRIS product implementation, Partner Groups, new functionality and process improvements.
* Develop and maintain HRIS procedures, guidelines, and documentation.
* Perform other duties as assigned


***Qualifications, Education and Skills Requirements:***


* Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related field.
* Minimum of 2 years of HRIS system administration experience with the UKG Ready platform.
* Experience creating and maintaining documentation for system usage.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Must be detail oriented and a self-starter.
* Experience in a client service environment handling multiple external clients and ability to present ideas and programs
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent interpersonal and technical support skills
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software (*experience with Excel V-lookup is particularly helpful*)

  


***Preferred Skills:***


* Professional Human Resource and/or Benefits certifications (e.g., PHR, SHRM-CP, CEBS)

title: Accounting Specialist
description:
For more than 70 years, Heatherwood has been in the business of developing, redeveloping, and managing quality apartment communities in the New York region. Heatherwood is one of New York’s leading development companies in luxury residential communities, commercial properties, and luxury urban spaces with a portfolio that spans from Brooklyn and Queens to the east end of Long Island. Heatherwood currently owns and operates thousands of apartments and employs approximately 250 associates.

  



The Accounting Specialist will be responsible for maintaining financial records, processing transactions, and preparing reports. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of accounting principles and be skilled in managing a variety of accounting tasks with accuracy and efficiency.

  


**Responsibilities and Duties**
-------------------------------


* Process accounts payable and receivable transactions.
* Reconcile bank statements and general ledger accounts.
* Perform month-end and year-end closing activities.
* Maintain accurate records of all financial transactions
* Assist with payroll processing as needed.
* Communicate with vendors and customers regarding billing and payments inquiries.
* Assist with reconciling credit card transactions.
* Assist in the preparation of financial reports and various accounting statements.
* Support the finance team with other accounting tasks as required.

  


**Skills**
----------

* Ability to visualize, articulate, and solve complex problems and concepts, and make decisions based on available information.
* Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Ability to use a computer and knowledge of standard and specific business applications, such as computerized accounting, e-mail, electronic spreadsheet development, database, and word processing; ability to learn new software applications.
* Maximum 4 years of experience in accounting or bookkeeping.
* Basic knowledge of accounting principles, processes, and terminology.
* Ability to work with concentration, accuracy, and attention to detail.
* Strong Microsoft Office Skills
* Ability to perform basic math: addition, subtraction, division, multiplication, and find percentages.
* Ability to work independently and work cooperatively with others.
* Accountability, a strong work ethic and a positive attitude are a must.
* Yardi experience a plus.

  


**Education**
-------------


* High School Diploma

title: Seafood Clerk
description:
Come join the freshest Seafood Department on the Island! Uncle Giuseppe's gourmet Marketplace serves its customers freshly delivered seafood, with a vast array of seafood choices. Many types of fish, crab, lobsters, clams, oysters, scallops and all of the seafood you could dream up, we have! Our Seafood Chefs cook seafood dishes, gourmet style, for our customers to grab and go for a gourmet cooked home meal!  


Our **North Babylon Store** is actively seeking a **PT** **Seafood Clerk** to join its seafood team! This position requires some experience working with seafood in a retail seafood store.  



Our **Seafood clerks** display seafood products and related items in a careful, clean, neat, and expedient manner while ensuring that all product is fresh, rotated and well stocked for our customers. Seafood clerks make recommendations for which fish or seafood products to purchase at the counter. Individual will address all customer service questions and concerns.  


**Responsibilities**
* The Seafood Clerk will display counters and cases are arranged, stocked, and replenished with ice and seafood product.
* Check and verify freshness of seafood items in live tanks. Verify and remove foul or spoiled product and rotate merchandise
* The Seafood Clerk will assist customers on seafood products, prices and service.
* Offer assistance in finding or suggesting the selection of seafood product. Prepare special seafood fillets and cuts as requested by customers.
* The Seafood Clerk will weigh, price, and package customer selections using weigh scales, label machine and wrapping machine.
* Process merchandise according to production guidelines and follow established sanitation standards.
* The Seafood Clerk will keep displays iced according to company policy and change ice as scheduled
* Receive and unload seafood delivery truck and store product in designated area.
* Receive supplies, organize and maintain inventory of newly received merchandise.
* Monitor cooler, display cases, and tanks for correct temperature to assure product quality.
* The Seafood Clerk will maintain a clean and neat department, free from safety hazards; report hazards to management.
* Work in a safe and proper manner, exercising safe food handling practices.
* Exercise proper safety practices on use of all equipment.
* Operate and clean seafood equipment and tools.

  


**Requirements**
* 18 years of age or older
* HS Diploma or equivalent
* Must have at least 1 year of experience working in a seafood department of a grocery store or seafood store
* Working knowledge of seafood preparations and displays within a seafood department
* Ability to deliver friendly, courteous, prompt customer service
* Must be able to speak, read and understand the English language
* Ability to interpret, understand and follow instructions and solve problems

  


***We offer comprehensive benefits package to our employees. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO time, 50% discount on lunch, 25% store discount and more!***

title: Bakery Clerk
description:
If you enjoy baked goods in a gourmet store environment, you will love our Bakery Clerk position! We have an immediate need for a **PT Bakery Clerk** in our **Morris Plains, NJ** store.

  



Our Bakery Clerks create an outstanding customer experience through exceptional service. Bakery Clerks should be friendly, greet and be courteous to customers and work with management and other associates to provide a high level of customer service.

  


**Responsibilities**


* Maintain a clean, neat, organized and safe work environment
* Clean and sanitize all work surfaces, utensils and equipment in accordance with the NYS Standards as well as QA standards
* Keep floors clean and clear of debris and spills
* Greet all customers and provide them with prompt, courteous service and assistance
* Maintain and properly use all department equipment as require
* Rotate product to ensure freshness
* Ensure accurate signage for the department
* Prepare trays to Company’s and customer’s satisfaction.
* Perform all duties in accordance with Local, State and Federal regulations as they pertain to the Bakery operation.
* Perform all duties in accordance with Company rules, policies, safety requirements, and security standards and all Local, State and Federal health and civil code regulations.
* Other duties and functions as assigned


**Requirements**


* High school diploma or equivalent
* Flexibility to work around customer demands, including early morning, night, weekend and holiday availability.
* Must be able to speak, read and understand the English language

  


***We offer a competitive benefits package to our FT and PT employees. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, pet insurance, 50% discount on lunch, 25% store discount and more!***

title: Salad Bar Clerk
description:
Our **Melville** store has an immediate need for a **PT Salad Bar Clerk** for its busy Salad Bar! Our Salad Bar Clerks are responsible for preparing fresh salads for walk up counter customers. This individual will be responsible for taking the orders of customers and making the desired salad menu item. This will include placing all items selected by the customer into large bowl and chopping them while the customer waits for the finished product.

  


**Responsibilities**


* Prepares salads and salad items in a large bowl, chopping for a final product to present to the customer
* Mixes ingredients with dressing as desired by the customer
* Ensures a clean working station before and after each customer
* Practices a safe serving area by adhering to all of our food handling polices
* Other duties and functions as assigned


**Requirements**


* HS graduate or equivalent
* Must have experience using kitchen knives and commercial cutting machines
* Must understand and follow our policies and procedures regarding safety in the kitchen and safe handling practices for food
* Must be able to speak, read and understand the English language

title: Catering Driver
description:
We have an immediate need at our Uncle Giuseppe's **Smithtown** **Store** for a **PT Catering Driver** for our busy Catering Department. Our Catering Driver’s primary responsibility is to get the world’s best gourmet food quickly and safely from the store to the customer’s location. Catering Drivers are responsible for delivering all items and setting them up at the customer’s requested approved location.  


This position requires the individual to operate our company vehicle according to all local, state and federal regulations and maintain the vehicle in a safe manner while carrying large quantities of food. ***(A CDL is NOT required for this position and a company SUV is provided for our food deliveries).***  


**Responsibilities**
* The Catering Driver must operate our vehicles according to all local, state, and federal regulations and maintain a vehicle in a manner capable of carrying large quantities of food.


* Assist with in store pick-ups


* Tasks included packing orders, packing paper good tickets, preparing condiments


* Setting orders up to meet client expectations


* Will require working off premised events such as BBQ's, Omelets events, Weddings etc. (Pay differential)


* Deliver outstanding customer service


* Loading and unloading of catering equipment from vehicles


**Requirements**
* Must be at least 19 years of age or older


* HS Degree or equivalent


* 2+ years of driving experience in addition to a minimum of one (1) year Delivery Driver experience


* Must have reliable transportation and driver’s insurance


* Must be able to work varied hours / days and start shift at early hours


* Must work well in a fast paced environment


* Requires the ability to multitask and switch tasks quickly


* Must work well with other team members


* Must be able to read, write and speak in the English Language


* Valid NYS Drivers License

  


***We offer a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401(K), 50% off lunch, 25% off in store shopping and more!***  


**Working Conditions**
* Most of the time is spent moving about continuously on hard surfaces. There may be a need to frequently position oneself to examine and/or scan merchandise, including bending, climbing, crawling, handling, pulling, reaching, and stooping.
* May require lifting objects up to 30 pounds. May require lifting and moving heavy and/or awkward objects more than 30 pounds with assistance.
* Usually in a comfortable indoor environment surrounded by moving machinery and/or loud equipment that may require shouting in order to be heard. There could be exposure to temperature extremes from freezers, ovens, and/or coolers.
* There may be occasional exposure to cleaning agents, sharp objects/industrial equipment necessary to perform job duties and functions.

title: Espresso Clerk
description:

Excellent communication skills and cash register experience are required!  



Our Barista-Espresso Clerks are responsible for making and serving beverages to customers at our Espresso and Coffee bars.

title: Customer Service Clerk
description:
Our **Morris Plains, NJ Store** is seeking to add a **Part-Time Customer Service Clerk** to its team! Come join the best gourmet food store around! Uncle Giuseppe's is proud of its gourmet food selections and baked goods. If you love assisting people and have excellent customer service skills, come join our family!  


**Summary**

Our **Customer Service Clerks** assist customers by answering customer questions at our service desk and provide helpful suggestions about our products and services.  


**Responsibilities**
* Open and maintain customer loyalty accounts by recording account information
* Resolve product or service problems by clarifying the customer's complaint; determining the cause of the problem; selecting and explaining the best solution to solve the problem; expediting correction or adjustment; following up to ensure resolution

title: Meat Clerk
description:
Our **Melville Store** is seeking a **PT Meat Clerk** for its busy department. We also work weekends to take care of our customers, so bring your customer service skills and join the Melville team today... Butchering skills are not needed but will be welcomed!

  



Our Meat Clerks provide assistance to customers by providing excellent customer service and assisting with their shopping needs in the Meat Department. Will receive and unpack meat, clean and sanitize all equipment and working surfaces while following company guidelines within the Meat Department.

  


**Responsibilities:**


* Provides assistance to customers by answering questions regarding meats and poultry. Makes recommendations on food products as requested by customers
* Weighs, packages, wraps, and labels cuts of meat and poultry, including grinds. Assists the meat cutter in packaging freshly cut meats and poultry. May grind hamburger meat
* Inspects and stores meat upon delivery. Ensures that all delivered meat meets or exceeds company quality standards
* Ensures the meat cases are fully stocked. Rotates meats and poultry, according to expiration dates. Follows established guidelines when disposing of damaged and/or expired products
* Receives and unpacks meat and poultry in the meat cooler and freezer
* Cleans and sanitizes all equipment, display fixtures, and areas in the meat department, including the meat cooler, freezer, and refrigerated display cases
* Maintains all store policies and procedures
* Performs other duties as assigned, including working in other departments as needed
* Regular, predictable, full attendance is an essential function of this job
* Other duties and functions as assigned

  


**Requirements**


* Must be at least 18 years of age
* Previous experience working in a Meat Department, working with fresh meat
* Knowledge of automatic/hand wrapping machines preferred
* Ability to work in a fast paced environment while providing excellent customer service
* Able to work all shifts or shifts as provided with schedule

  


***We offer a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401(K), 50% off lunch, 25% off store shopping and more!***

  


**Working Conditions**


* Most of the time is spent moving about continuously on hard surfaces. There may be a need to frequently position oneself to examine and/or scan merchandise, including bending, climbing, crawling, handling, pulling, reaching, and stooping.
* May require lifting objects up to 30 pounds. May require lifting and moving heavy and/or awkward objects more than 30 pounds with assistance.
* Usually in a comfortable indoor environment surrounded by moving machinery and/or loud equipment that may require shouting in order to be heard. There could be exposure to temperature extremes from freezers, ovens, and/or coolers.

title: Cart Collector
description:

**Cart Collectors** are primarily responsible for the shopping carts in and around our buildings. ***Cart Collector Skills and Qualifications***



Cart Porters at Uncle Giuseppe's Marketplace are dependable individuals who are committed to keeping the parking lot and building areas and facilities pleasant and free from clutter. They are thorough with their cleaning while remaining observant of their surroundings. Employers look for cart porters with the following skills and qualifications:

* Self starter who takes initiative within position
* Must be able to speak, read and understand the English language

***We offer a great salary and benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401(K), life insurance, 50% off lunch, 25% off store shopping and more!***

title: Deli Clerk

Available at least one weekend day and several weekdays is ideal

title: Dairy Clerk
description:
Bring your love for Dairy and your passion for work to Uncle G's Marketplace! title: Student Work Study
description:
Position: Student Work Study


Department: Center for Natural Resources


Reports to: , boufadel@njit.edu


Hours per week: 20


Employment Period:


Pay Rate: 15.13 - 15.13


Position Description:


Assists with the project according to CNR guidelines. Collects samples, conduct analysis and prepares reports with the advise of postdoctoral researcher. Works on the essential functions assigned by the CNR director.

title: Clinical Research Nurse - Children's Hospital - F/T Days
description:
Overview:

Our team members are the heart of what makes us better. At Hackensack Meridian Health we help our patients live better, healthier lives — and we help one another to succeed. With a culture rooted in connection and collaboration, our employees are team members. Here, competitive benefits are just the beginning. It’s also about how we support one another and how we show up for our community. Together, we keep getting better - advancing our mission to transform healthcare and serve as a leader of positive change.  

The **Clinical Research Nurse** is responsible for coordinating and overseeing clinical research operations for all assigned clinical trials and participates in assessing, planning, implementing and evaluating Compliant Patient Care in clinical research trials. The Clinical Research Nurse carries out the research and works under the general supervision of the principal investigator responsible for the clinical trials.
Qualifications:
**Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:*** BSN required. (Note: this applies to team members hired or transferred on or after March 31, 2024. Team members hired or transferred prior to March 31, 2024 require a minimum of an associate in Nursing or diploma of Nursing degree.)
* Minimum of 3 years clinical nursing experience or 1 year of clinical nursing experience with an additional 2 years of clinical research experience
* Adheres to the American Nurses Association standards
* Strong attention to detail and customer service focus is required
* Excellent communication, organizational, presentation, documentation, and interpersonal skills are required
* Ability to work independently, or in a team, and handle multiple deadline driven tasks in a dynamic environment is essential
* Proficient computer skills that include but are not limited to Microsoft Office and/or Google Suite platforms
* Review and comply with all relevant HMH and Business Unit policies and procedures, and local, state, and Federal laws and regulations
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Proficient computer skills that include but are not limited to Microsoft Office and/or Google Suite platforms

 **Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:*** National Certification in area of specialty preferred when eligible

**Licenses and Certifications Required:*** NJ State Professional Registered Nurse License
* AHA Basic Health Care Life Support HCP Certification within 60 days of entering position

 **Licenses and Certifications Preferred:*** Certified Clinical Research Professional (CCRP) and/or Certified Clinical Research Associate (CCRA) and/or Certified Clinical Research Coordinator (CCRC)


Responsibilities:
* Assists the principal investigator in the preparation of proposed clinical trials by reviewing trial protocol, contacting each department who will provide resources during study and ensuring appropriate departments are notified and given a copy of proposed trial, scientific merit and accrual potential.
* Assures that all protocol revisions, informed consents, continuing reviews, serious adverse events are submitted to the appropriate IRB of record in a timely manner.
* Acts as liaison between principal investigators and sub-investigators on all regulatory issues and changes within the protocol.
* Interacts with regulatory specialists and principal investigators and sub-investigators on all regulatory issues and changes within the protocol.
* In collaboration with the principal investigator, clinical research coordinator, and clinical team, participates in the review of studies for feasibility and evaluates potential competition with other protocols prior to submitting study.
* Reviews study with principal investigator and/or clinical research coordinator to a budget outlining standard of care and research costs. Finalizes budget draft with budget coordinator.
* Recruits and evaluates potential study patients, and works with clinical research coordinator to schedule required appointments and interviews.
* Identifies the needs of the patient population served and modifies and delivers care that is specific to those needs (i.e., age, culture, hearing and/or visually impaired, etc.). This process includes communicating with the patient, parent, and/or primary caregiver(s) at their level (developmental/age, educational, literacy, etc.).
* Reviews medical records for potential study patients and ensures that medical records include documentation of all laboratory test results and procedures and progress of study patients, following guidelines set forth by the protocol sponsors.
* Instructs potential study patients, designated caregiver, physicians, nurse clinicians and other ancillary staff members involved in the care of the patient on aspects of patient¿s care, available trials, treatments and side effects.
* Assists investigator with consent process assuring study patients understand clinical trials and obtains written informed consent.
* Educates study patients concerning informed consent procedures, HIPAA authorization.
* Documents study patient¿s medical history including but not limited to past medical/surgical treatments, significant medical conditions, and medication history per protocol guidelines.
* Performs nursing assessments and monitors study patient's progress during clinical trials; Tracks study patient¿s response by documenting on toxicity flow sheet, medication flow sheet and nurses¿ progress notes.
* Maintains accurate, complete, up-to-date records on each patient participating in a clinical trial protocol in all applicable systems (i.e. electronic medical record, clinical trial management system, departmental and protocol specific databases).
* Evaluates and develops study patient education materials and gives study patient and/or designated caregiver instructions on drug administration and other medical information; creates study specific calendars for study patients.
* Plans for study patient¿s appropriate care under the direction of a physician or advanced practice nurse.
* Notifies principal investigator of any adverse events and serious adverse events, including evidence of drug toxicity or unexpected side effects.
* Reports all serious adverse events to sponsor and IRB of record according to established timelines.
* Coordinates research activities not limited to: scheduling laboratory tests, radiology testing and other medical exams.
* Performs and/or oversees a variety of clinical duties that may include but not limited to: EKGs, processing/shipping of blood serum, urine and communicates results to PI and/or APN.
* Together with the principal investigator, reviews and processes all Safety Reports (INDs, SUGARs) as per institutional policies and procedures.
* Acts as principal investigator¿s representative as appropriate. This may include, but not limited to, communicating with sponsors and their representatives, the IRB and other medical personnel.
* Maintains accurate, complete, up-to-date records on each patient participating in a clinical trial protocol.
* Ensures study patient's clinical trial related activities are billed appropriately and reconciles drug study account records with research finance personnel.
* Prepares and assists for sponsor monitor site visits and ensures all supporting documentation records are adequate and available for the visit; Meets with monitor at least once during each monitor site visit and resolves all issues found during visit.
* Develops case report forms and/or databases for physician initiated studies as needed.
* Assists the principal investigator in preparing for publication. Works with analysts and assists with queries related to data to evaluate the significance of collected data.
* Provides education to all departments and clinical areas where study is performed.
* Attends research meetings and conferences as required.
* Participates in staff meetings and in-service education of nursing and medical staff.
* Other duties and/or projects as assigned.
* Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.

description:

Responsibilities:

A day in the life of a Patient Care Technician at Hackensack Meridian Health includes:* Provide patient care, based on physical, psychosocial, education, safety, and related criteria, appropriate to the age of the guests/patients served in assigned service
* Provide for effective and safe guest/patients outcomes through practice, judgment and critical actions
* Ongoing communication with patients, nursing colleagues and other members of the health care team regarding patient's status and rendered care
* Take self-directed or self-motivated initiative to do more than is expected or required in the job, acting before being required to by events, improving job performance, and/or creating new opportunities
* Participate in interdisciplinary collaboration of our patient's plan of care from admission to discharge to ensure safe transitioning and continuum of care
* Participate in Unit/Department Performance Improvement [PI] activities Specific Job Functions may include but not limited to:
* Welcomes patients and checks for proper identification bracelets.
* Prepares the patient for assessment/admission, physical examination and procedures.
* Recognizes and responds to opportunities to enhance patient satisfaction.
* Demonstrates the knowledge and skill necessary to provide care appropriate to age of patients on the
* Obtains clinical data, temperature, pulse, respirations, blood pressure, O2 saturation and documents findings in patient record and notifies RN immediately of abnormal results.
* Draws intravenous or capillary blood from newborn through geriatric aged patients using proper aseptic collection techniques, assure appropriate labeling and processing of specimens to expedite throughput of
* Performs venipuncture for laboratory tests
* Demonstrates a reliable and dependable ability to follow through with designated responsibilities in the collecting, labeling, and transporting of specimens to the proper area at the appropriate time: always correctly labels type of specimen collected, including patients name and room number.
* Performs EKG for patients as directed.
* Assures the presence, functionality and cleanliness of all necessary equipment. Checks and maintains code cart, O2, and other emergency medical equipment as directed.
* Applies bandages, slings, compression boots and hypothermia blankets according to standard as directed by RN.
* Assists in the transport of patient to departments or units upon request.
* Assists with preparation as necessary assuring the patient is assisted with meals/ or fed as needed.
* Checks inventory of assigned area and restocks as directed.
* Ensures room environment is prepared for admission.
* Provides direct hygiene and comfort care to patients including bathing, toileting, oral hygiene, incontinent care, and bed making.
* Assists the patients with dressing/undressing and placing patient belongings in the appropriate bag labeled with completed property checklist. Monitors the return of clothing to family of patient.
* Performs and documents glucose finger sticks and collects other specimens as directed.
* Provides post mortem care
* Obtains and documents patient weights and observes and documents patient's intake and output.
* Provides a safe patient environment by answering call lights promptly, communicating with the RN immediately for any change in the patient's condition.
* Identifies the needs of the patient population served and modifies and delivers care that is specific to those needs not limited to (i.e., age, culture, language, hearing and/or visually impaired, etc.). This process includes communicating with the patient, parent, and/or primary caregiver(s) at their level (developmental/age, educational, literacy, etc.)
* Other duties and/or projects as assigned.
* Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.


Qualifications:
* High School Diploma or Equivalent
* Completion of one of the following:
+ Certified Nursing Assistant, Medical Assistant or Patient Care Technician program or
+ Fundamentals of Nursing program from an accredited school of nursing or
+ HMH PCT Apprenticeship Program
+ Or equivalent medical background experience, such as EMT, Home Health Aide, CMA, MA, PCT, Nursing Assistant.

* AHA Basic Health Care Life Support HCP Certification within 60 days of hire
* Experienced or certified in phlebotomy and checking EKG, vital signs and blood sugar preferred
* At least one (1) year PCT or CNA experience in a hospital setting strongly preferred or eligible for the HMH PCT apprentice program.
* Certified Nursing Assistant, Certified Medical Assistant or Patient Care Technician who has successfully completed a PCT program which includes Phlebotomy, EKG and nursing assistant course both in the theoretical and clinical setting.

The Pharmacy Technician functions under the supervision of a licensed pharmacist, and assists the pharmacist(s) with the completion of their responsibilities. This includes: the preparation of medication orders for review by the pharmacist; maintenance of adequate drug supplies in filling areas; and delivery of medications to patient care areas. **Varying hours on weekdays between: 730am-7pm + 2 Saturdays per month: 9am-5pm**
Responsibilities:

A day in the life of a Pharmacy Technician at Hackensack Meridian *Health* includes:  

1. Inventory - Maintains accurate and appropriate inventories of medications and supplies. Supports the drug inventory process including rotation and restocking of drug dispensing areas with drugs and supplies needed to process patient medication orders.  

2. Regulatory compliance - Maintains a safe and clean work area by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations.  

3. Communication and teamwork - Communicates with other team members, physicians and patients in an effective and positive manner.  

4. Helps prepare intravenous admixtures according to established practices of aseptic techniques and pertinent department policies under the supervision of a registered pharmacist; assists in accurately labeling and dispensing inpatient unit dose medications according to department policy; delivers medications to patient care areas as needed.  

5. Assists in compounding medication by means of weighing, measuring, mixing, blending, filtering, distilling, emulsifying and titrating, according to standard pharmacy practices and department policy.  

6. Delivers and fills controlled substances and other medications to nursing units' automated medication dispensing cabinets (ADC) timely and accurately; assists in reconciling all narcotic discrepancies on a daily basis.  

7. Prepares medications and subsequently loads and unloads medications into ADC with appropriate barcode scanning.  

8. Answers phones according to established phone etiquette and directs calls to the proper personnel.  

9. Prepares and packages hazardous medications and other medications requiring special handling for subsequent administration to patients under the supervision of the pharmacist.  

10. Maintains all necessary paperwork, legal documents, and records for all medications, prepared for administration.  

11. Participates in departmental quality-assurance and safety activities for drug usage, infection control, and handling hazardous materials according to state/federal regulations and departmental policy; assists in the collection and review of patient-specific data used by pharmacists for monitoring drug therapy.  

12. Assumes responsibility for performance of job duties in the safest possible manner, to ensure personal safety and that of coworkers, and to report all preventable hazards and unsafe practices immediately to management.  

13. Other duties and/or projects as assigned.  

14. Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.

2. Effective oral and written English communication.  

3. Strong ability to multitask.  

4. Ability and willingness to work cooperatively with others.  

Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:
1. At least one year of pharmacy experience (outpatient or inpatient).  

Licenses and Certifications Required:
1. Valid New Jersey Pharmacy Technician registration or 180 day waiver.  

2. PTCB or ExCPT Certification Required within 6 months of start of employment with the following exceptions:  

Hired prior to January 2024 or

Works collaboratively with other members of the practice/hospital team to assess, plan and implement care for individuals with health and safety needs.**

**1. Provides medical assessments, treatments, clearances for HMH applicants, team members, constituents and external customers per specific company profiles & or regulatory standards. 2. Performs clinical care professionally, serving as a customer advocate and role model. 3. Clinical practice accurately reflects NJ Board of Medical Examiners regulations, Code of Ethics, the current NJ Department of Health requirements, and HMH policies and procedures. 4. Develops and implements appropriate plan of care. 5. Facilitates patient teaching and support programs for patients/ and employers 6. Evaluates current protocols and standards of care for translation of ¿best practice¿ into clinical practice. Supports the development of evidenced-based practice protocols and standards of care that include interventions and treatments to achieve desired outcomes. 7. Applies evidence and value-based practices to achieve positive outcomes for patients. 8. Provides medication safely and effectively to promote effective recovery from on-the-job injury/illness 9. Prescribes medications and/or recommends over-the-counter medications as appropriate. 10. Initiates laboratory tests, immunizations, and diagnostic test/procedures as appropriate according to regulation and scope of practice. 11. Demonstrates competent clinical skills with treatment plans using most effective screening test or procedure. 12. Collaborates with physician and consults effectively with other members of the health care team 13. Demonstrate effective communication skills interdisciplinary to achieve results 14. Provides accurate, systematic and organized documentation of findings, recommendations/plan and education 15. Independently participates in continuing education and maintains documentation. Develops a personal plan of development in area of clinical expertise, conferring with leader on goals and objectives. 16. Provides culturally diverse and educationally appropriate education in relation to patient care/needs. 17. Serves as a clinical resource to nursing staff, patients, and other multidisciplinary team members across the continuum to evaluate complex patients and identify appropriate interventions and evaluation of outcomes. 18. Participates in policy/procedure reviews for updating with current evidence-based and value-based practices 19. Acts as a resource to staff for addressing clinical, process, and system opportunities for improvement which promote excellence in care and clinical outcomes. 20. title: Sterile Processing Technician - Full Time
description:
Overview:

Our team members are the heart of what makes us better. At Hackensack Meridian *Health* we help our patients live better, healthier lives — and we help one another to succeed. The certified Sterile Processing Technician within the Sterile Processing Department (SPD) performs all tasks associated with the processing of surgical instruments and medical devices including cleaning, decontamination, assembly, sterilization/high level disinfection; monitoring of environmental conditions, sterilization processes, and HLD processes; assembly and dispatching of case carts and emergency carts; and inventory and ordering of SPD supplies.
Responsibilities:

A day in the life of a Sterile Processing Technician at Hackensack Meridian *Health* includes:  

1. Assists in processing of instruments, surgical trays, and surgical case carts. Performs duties in the Processing area. Maintains knowledge of instruments and trays and can assemble trays and sets as detailed on set layout sheets. Can operate correctly all machinery associated with the Decontamination and Processing area and identify problems that affect the quality of the product produced.  

2. Checks expiration dates on sterile items. Checks for outdated items and takes appropriate action if discovered.  

3. Demonstrates proper phone etiquette. Uses proper procedure with callers on the business unit and OR Hotline phones in a courteous and efficient manner.  

4. Makes daily soil rounds of the medical units. Performs daily soil rounds, visiting all required areas and returns all items to SPD for processing.  

5. Performs functions in Decontamination area. Responsible for cleaning the instruments, trays and carts. Performs decontamination duties without direction. Has the ability to control the workflow in the Decontamination area.  

6. Records all processed loads and keeps accurate records. Accurately enters information into record books required to track processed loads. Records Biological indicators into required logs and places Biological indicators into the proper incubator to be processed. Removes Biological indicators after proper time period and accurately records outcome of testing.  

7. Responsible for SPD department stock. Puts away supplies in the SPD department and rotates stock as needed. Duties are performed with reasonable speed and definite accuracy.  

8. Responsible for the daily operations of the business unit in the Supervisor's absence. Demonstrates ability to take charge and appropriately assigns team members in the interest of business unit and ultimately patient care.  

9. Responsible for the daily operations of the business unit in the Coordinator's and/or Supervisor's absence. (Technicians with charge responsibilities.) Demonstrates the ability to take charge of the processing functions by appropriately facilitating the team members in the performance of their assignments in the best interest of the business unit and ultimately patient care.  

10. Steam and Sterrad sterilization of instruments and medical devices. Operates steam and Sterrad sterilization equipment in compliance with manufacturer's instructions, policies and procedures, and Infection Prevention.  

11. Lifts a minimum of 30 lbs., pushes and pulls a minimum of 50 lbs. and stands a minimum of length of shift.  

12. Other duties and/or projects as assigned.  

13. Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.


Qualifications:

Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
1. High School diploma, general equivalency diploma (GED), and/or GED equivalent programs.
  

2. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  

3. Proficient computer skills that include but are not limited to Microsoft Office and/or Google Suite platforms.  

Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:
1. Experience with STERRAD sterilization.  

Licenses and Certifications Required:
1. National Certification: Certified Registered Central Service Technician (CRCST) or Certification Board for Sterile Processing and Distribution (CBSPDT).  

Working Conditions:
Lifts a minimum of 30 lbs., pushes and pulls a minimum of 50 lbs. and stands a minimum of length of shift.  

If you feel the above description speaks directly to your strengths and capabilities, then please apply today!

title: Patient Access Specialist-FT-Day
description:
Overview:

“Our team members are the heart of what makes us better. At Hackensack Meridian Health we help our patients live better, healthier lives — and we help one another to succeed. With a culture rooted in connection and collaboration, our employees are team members. Here, competitive benefits are just the beginning. Come join our Amazing team here at Hackensack Meridian Health! We offer EXCELLENT benefits, Scheduling Flexibility, Tuition Reimbursement, Employee Discounts and much more!!!  

The Patient Access Specialist is responsible for all Inpatient and Outpatient Patient Access functions within the Patient Access Services Department in their assigned area/hospital(s) at Hackensack Meridian Health (HMH). Conducts quality interviews with every patient to ensure compliance with patient safety rules and state and federal regulations. Gathers appropriate identification for patients and confirms all patient demographics to validate patient identity. Conducts intensive screening of all Medicare, Medicaid and managed care patients to identify network status and coordination of benefits. Obtains all applicable patient consents/attestations. Performs job related functions including, but not limited to, facility based scheduling, bed planning, pre-registration, registration, insurance verification, pre-certification, point of service cash collection and financial clearance under the direction of the Supervisor/Manager/Director for these designated areas. Must adhere to the Medical Center's Quality Standards and maintain a positive patient experience at all times.
Responsibilities:
* Greets patients and visitors in person/phone in a prompt, courteous, respectful and helpful manner.
* Implements the Medical Center's scheduling, pre-registration, pre-certification, referral procurement and insurance verification policies and procedures for the assigned outpatient point of service.
* Adheres to patient identification policy and ensures an accurate patient search is performed in order to maintain patient safety and prevent duplicate medical record numbers.
* Check-in and account for the location and arrival/processing time of patients to ensure prompt service with the established departmental time frames and guidelines.
* Ensures Regulatory Forms are filled out and signed by the patient.
* Performs all functions of bed planning; reservations/pre-registration/bed assignment.
* Prioritizes bed assignment in accordance with policy.
* Ensures patients are assigned to the proper unit according to admit order.
* Reviews orders to ensure patient is in appropriate status and level of care.
* Initiate real time eligibility query (RTE) on all eligible insurances. Must review RTE response to ensure correct plan code assignment and correct coordination of benefits to facilitate timely reimbursement.
* Ensure accurate completion of Medicare Secondary Payer Questionnaire.
* Performs insurance verification on all Inpatient and Outpatient services, and determines the patient's out of pocket responsibility via the EPIC Financial Estimator tool using the applicable data.
* Where appropriate, pursues upfront cash collections to assist patients in understanding their financial responsibilities and minimize overall bad debt.
* Informs patients of their out of pocket responsibility taking payment via credit card or in person and explaining financial resources including financial assistance, payment plans or payment on date of service.
* Verifies benefits to ensure the procedure is a covered service under the patients plan prior to receiving services.
* Verifies pre-authorization requirements and follows up with both the referring physician and payer to ensure authorizations are on file for the scheduled procedure prior to date of service.
* Submits all data timely, effectively and expeditiously for all treatments and procedures to ensure authorizations have been obtained and determine that the procedure or treatment is authorized prior to date of service.
* Ensures diagnosis data that is entered on registration is accurate and meets medical necessity criteria.
* Complies with HMH's patient financial responsibility and collection policies.
* Provides patients with appropriate administrative information, as directed.
* Maintains compliance with federal/state requirements and ensures signatures are obtained on all required regulatory/consent forms.
* Manually registers patients accurately when in `downtime' mode and properly follows registration input procedures when the system becomes available.
* Attempts to mediate daily scheduling, pre-registration, pre-certification or registration issues and elevates any issues that cannot be resolved independently.
* Completes assigned work queue (WQ) accounts in a timely and efficient manner.
* Assumes other responsibilities as directed by either the Supervisor, Manager or Director of Patient Access.
* Identifies the needs of the patient population served and modifies and delivers care that is specific to those needs (i.e., age, culture, language, hearing and/or visually impaired, etc.). This process includes communicating with the patient, parent, and/or primary caregiver(s) at their level (developmental/age, educational, literacy, etc.).
* Ensures delivery of excellent customer service resulting in a positive patient experience.
* Complies with all procedural workflows and departmental policies and procedures as identified.
* Responsible for scanning any documents and correspondence from patients and payers.
* Coordinates daily activities of the Patient Access Department which fosters an environment promoting patient comfort and trust.
* Have the ability to schedule patients as needed.
* Answers a high volume number of phone calls and responds in an appropriate/professional manner. Address and resolve any issues quickly/accurately.
* Ensures timely notification of admission to payers and refers accounts to Case Management for timely submission of Clinical Information to payer.
* Verifies eligibility and benefits to ensure patient's coverage is active and that the procedure is a covered service under the patient's plan prior to the date of service.
* Verifies pre-authorization requirements and follows up with both the referring physician's office and payer to ensure authorizations are on file for the scheduled procedure prior to the date of service.
* Able to access and navigate various payer websites (e.g. Navinet) to confirm patients' insurance coverage and policy benefits.
* Works with patients to financially clear their account per policy at least 3 days prior to procedure. Resolves any issues with coverage and escalates any complications to supervisor/manager. Makes referrals to Financial Counselors if appropriate.
* Accurate and timely processing of all methods of acceptable payments such as cash/check/money order/credit card transactions. Reconciling daily cash drawer or shift payment transactions, depositing daily cash/check and providing patients with cash receipts, and/or service estimate.
* Completes a pre-registration on all appropriate patients in Epic. Able to clear a checklist in Epic and set an account status to `Confirmed pre-reg.'
* Contacts patients and/or physicians' offices in regards to Pre-Admission Testing scheduling in a timely and efficient manner.
* Obtains patient records, types and processes scheduling information included but not limited to copying, filing, faxing and answering phone calls in an accurate, efficient and professional manner.
* Can work in all Access Services areas within the hospital and may rotate shifts as needed.
* Checks email daily to maintain timely updates on any process/task changes/updates.
* Meet departmental daily productivity and process standards.
* Other duties and/or projects as assigned.
* Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.


Qualifications:

Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
* High School diploma, general equivalency diploma (GED), and/or GED equivalent programs.
* Ability to work rotating schedules/shifts based on needs.
* Good written and verbal communication skills.

The Transportation Aide is responsible for transporting patients and/or specimens upon request throughout the assigned area.
Responsibilities:
* Transports patients by the use of wheelchairs and with stretcher/bed transports, ensuring safe handling of patients to prevent falls.
* Transports patients to and from appropriate units or Imaging Modalities within expected time frames, and also ensuring the patient's chart is brought along.
* Maintains regular and open communication with Dispatch/Modality/Unit to notify of receipt of task, changes or delays in transport, and completion of tasks. Open communication is important to avoid non-productive time.
* Ensure that patient support apparatus such as IV pumps and oxygen tanks are handled safely during transport. Responsible for removing equipment from service that is unsafe or unclean. Responsible for oxygen tank exchange.
* Where applicable, obtains supplies from central supply as requested.
* Transporter follows established isolation protocol in use of personal protective equipment and hand washing techniques.
* Transporter uses two patient identifiers to correctly identify patient.
* Proper protocol followed for patient expirations.
* Where applicable, transports specimens to the laboratory, and delivers blood and blood products in a timely manner. Proper protocol followed for specimens/blood work.
* Where applicable, picks up slides for physicians to review from laboratory as requested.
* Participates/uses the automated systems in a timely and accurate manner to assist with patient throughput.
* Lifts a minimum of 10 lbs., pushes and pulls a minimum of 50 lbs. and stands a minimum of length of shift.
* Identifies the needs of the patient population served and modifies and delivers care that is specific to those needs (i.e., age, culture, language, hearing and/or visually impaired, etc.). This process includes communicating with the patient, parent, and/or primary caregiver(s) at their level (developmental/age, educational, literacy, etc.).
* Assists with environmental duties in departments or units including pick up and disposal of recycling/trash receptacles; also linen removal from laundry bins to proper disposal area such as chutes for collection as requested. Adhere to cleaning requirements and procedures as assigned
* Adheres to the standards identified in the Medical Center's Organizational Competencies.


Qualifications:

Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
* High School diploma, general equivalency diploma (GED), and/or GED equivalent programs.
* Utilizes social skills and communicates appropriately to alleviate fears and/or anxiety of the patient and provide the Best Healthcare Experience.

The Perioperative Associate assists in planning, organizing, implementing and evaluating the activities occurring in the nursing station by performing clerical and receptionist duties and maintaining the physical environment of the area at Palisades Medical Center (PMC) within Hackensack Meridian Health (HMH).  


Responsibilities:
* Performs clerical functions within the Unit: Answers telephone in a timely manner, takes messages, and communicates messages to the appropriate person.
* Transcribes and transmits physician¿s orders to appropriate areas under the supervision of a registered nurse.
* Schedules patients in the scheduling system for Endoscopy, infusions, blood transfusions, injections and OR cases. Enters add-on cases in the scheduling system.
* Maintains an organized system for scheduling patients by ensuring all scheduled cases have a confirmation number entered on the booking sheet, the booking sheet is faxed to the physicians office as a confirmation and the booking sheets are filed appropriately. Communicates clearly to the Director or designee, of any scheduling issues.
* Assembles patient charts correctly. Maintains correct format of forms in patient¿s chart, utilizes forms with correct language (Spanish or English), ensures they are complete (contain the correct label, each page is labeled. Makes sure the H&P, orders and lab work are in the chart).
* Enters patient information on the chart and in the computer system paying close attention to detail and accuracy.
* Confirms that the account number on the patient label matches the account number in the computer, to prevent two different account numbers being used at the same time for documentation.
* Adheres to the current HIPAA regulations concerning patient and employee confidentiality, safeguards all medical information.
* Coordinates with the Charge Nurse in facilitating the progression of the OR, ENDO and infusion schedules. Maintains an understanding of where the schedule is at any given time (who is in surgery, what patient is next for endo, who needs to be admitted).
* Calls patients into the unit from the waiting room in order of surgical time and properly identifies them with the name and medical record number. Provides clear instructions to the patients and their families.
* Updates and prints OR/ENDO schedules from the scheduling system.
* Discharges patients from the computer system in a timely fashion.
* Disassembles all charts of discharged patients within the same shift that the patient was discharged from the hospital and placed in designated area.
* Calls cancelled infusion patients to schedule another appointment.
* Other duties and/or projects as assigned.
* Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.


Qualifications:

Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
* High School diploma, general equivalency diploma (GED), and/or GED equivalent programs.
* Minimum of 2 years clerical experience in a hospital.
* Computer competent: able to utilize Word, Excel, Sorian, ORSOS.

Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:
* Scheduling experience.
* Knowledge of CPT codes, ICD-9, ICD-10CM
* Knowledge of medical terminology

The Security Officer will assume responsibility for the safety and well-being of patients, team members, physicians, visitors, students and Medical Center property. Responsibilities:
* Make continuous patrols throughout the Medical Center to observe and take corrective action regarding violations and detrimental conditions related to security and safety of patients, visitors, team members, students and property either on foot or in a vehicle. Security Team Members act as visible deterrence to crime and prohibited activities.

* Attend all mandatory meetings (departmental or special).
* Subject to all weather conditions; will be required to work in all areas of the Medical Center, including parking lots, grounds and outer buildings as requested.

description:

At **Hackensack Meridian** ***Health*** we help our patients live better, healthier lives — and we help one another to succeed. The role integrates and coordinates utilization management, care coordination, discharge planning functions and performance improvement activities for all care managers. The Supervisor, Care Management is accountable for oversight of the department's designated team member caseloads and plans effectively in order to meet staffing needs, manage length of stay, promote efficient utilization of resources and ensure that care meets evidence-based practice standards and regulatory/payor requirements.


Qualifications:
**Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:*** Bachelor's degree, Nursing or Master's Degree in Social Work.
* At least 3 years full time experience in an acute care setting.
* Familiar with hospital resources, community resources, and/or resource/utilization management.
* Care coordination, case management or discharge planning experience.
* Effective decision-making /problem-solving skills, demonstration of creativity in problem-solving, and influential leadership skills.
* Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills. Moderate to expert computer skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Proficient computer skills that may include but are not limited to Microsoft Office and/or Google Suite platforms.

**Licenses and Certifications Required:*** NJ State Professional Registered Nurse License or NJ Licensed Social Worker or NJ Licensed Clinical Social Worker.

**Licenses and Certifications Preferred:*** Basic Cardiac Life Support Certificate.


If you feel that the above description speaks directly to your strengths and capabilities, then please apply today!

  



Responsibilities:

A day in the life of a **Supervisor, Care Management** at **Hackensack Meridian** ***Health*** includes:* Facilitates collaborative management of patient care across the continuum, intervening as necessary to remove barriers to timely and efficient care delivery and reimbursement.
* Supervises the staff with all care management processes, including LOS, throughput, patient flow and denials and appeals follow up.
* Applies process improvement methodologies in evaluating team member's documentation.
* Ensures that multidisciplinary rounds and team huddles are occurring.
* Provides direction to the multidisciplinary team as needed in difficult cases.
* Obtains, interprets and presents metrics related to care management.
* Attends key meetings and presents the information about existing case management processes.

* Coordinates/facilitates patient care progression throughout the continuum by working collaboratively with the multidisciplinary team.
* Collaborates with ancillary departments to ensure accuracy of patient demographic and insurance information.
* Assists in the collection and reporting of indicators tracking efficiency of case management processes.
* Uses data to drive decisions and plan/implement performance improvement strategies related to assigned staff, including fiscal, clinical, and patient satisfaction data.
* Collaborates with Physician Advisors,/Hospitalist in needs related to Case Management and difficult cases.
* Maintains annual competencies and ensures training and continuing education of the team in applicable platforms. (Epic, Xsolis Cortex, BI, Google Suites)
* Assumes responsibility for supervision of other case management care coordination managers in the absence of a Supervisor.
* Other duties and/or projects as assigned.
* Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.

title: Janitor/Porter
description:
Responsibilities:

As a Porter at Related Management Company (RMC), your work is essential to a clean, safe, and beautiful property. You’ll perform upkeep and janitorial duties so that your property is always in great condition, demonstrating pride in your building and grounds. In this role, you’ll also have the opportunity to learn new skills, working closely with the maintenance team on small repairs and preventative activities. You’ll have the opportunity to learn, practice, and apply new skills for the next steps in your career in partnership with your property’s leaders too.**Responsibilities include:**

* Maintaining the cleanliness of the lobby, hallways, elevators, common areas, and restrooms (mop, sweep, strip/wax/buff floors, dust, vacuum and garbage removal)
* Light maintenance may be assigned
* Performs electrical repairs and/or replaces items such as appliances, fixtures, switches, outlets, circuit breakers, etc.
* Performs plumbing repairs such as replacing fittings, cleaning stoppages, replacing faucets, etc.
* Schedules service requests, adhering to maintenance priorities.
* Carpentry work; repairs asphalt, masonry and fencing when required
* Keeps accurate records regarding preventative maintenance, service request inventories and painting schedules.
* Provide excellent customer service to residents
* General upkeep of the buildings and grounds
* Snow removal and landscaping
* Maintain all equipment and supplies in proper condition
* Special projects as assigned

 **Compensation:**
$28.77 (Full Union Rate)
Qualifications:
* 1-2 years prior janitor, cleaner, or porter experience
* Must be reliable and have experience working with cleaning chemicals
* Must be a team player and be able to work with little supervision
* Excellent time management skills and work ethic needed
* Must be able to lift up to 50lbs and be able to stand for an 8 hour shift
* Light maintenance knowledge is a plus
* **You may be required to be on call as needed.**

Overview:

Related Management Company (RMC) is the owner and operator of a premier portfolio of assets valued at over $60 billion. Our operating portfolio consists of a diversified mix of properties including luxury rental buildings, retail and commercial space, luxury condominium residences, affordable and workforce housing located throughout the United States.


As the owner and developer for the majority of the RMC portfolio, we have ensured that our buildings are the best assets in their respective submarkets. We provide a diligently maintained property management platform with dedicated professionals who consistently exceeds our residents’ and commercial tenants’ expectations. Our dedication to providing the highest and most personalized level of service is one of the hallmarks of the company and a key differentiator in the market. For more please visit www.Related.com.
