* You oversee the overall in-store environment including but not limited to; Visual merchandising, store standards and cleanliness, replenishment, and marketing.
* We expect you to lead through the lens of productivity and profitability through strong operational controls including strategic scheduling, payroll control and Inventory management.
* You own the stores P & L and manage it through all controllable metrics; actively analyzes business trends and adjust accordingly.


**Requirements:*** You should have 4+ years of leadership experience, specifically within a department store - you must have strong leadership skills and the ability to effectively lead a team. Concession model leadership is highly preferred.
* We expect you to have a proven track record of hiring, leading, and developing effective retail teams.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills are required.
* The ability to work closely and effectively with others is important and expected.
* We expect you to have a deep understanding of customer service principles and the ability to provide exceptional service to all customers.
* You should possess strong problem-solving abilities and be able to handle any issues that may arise in the store.
* We expect you to have strong operational and organizational skills.
* We expect you to have strong visual merchandising skills, a keen eye for detail, ensuring that the store is always presented in a compelling manner.
* We value flexibility and expect you to be available to work evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed.



Skills :
Retail Experience, Leadership, Team Management, Store Operations, Visual Merchandising, Inventory Management, Problem-Solving, Time Management, Communication Skills, Organizational Skills, Detail Oriented, Customer Service, Business Analysis

SKIMS is committed to continuously creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates, reflective of the rich diversity of the communities we serve. Equitable workplaces foster innovation and excellence, and in our commitment to culture of belonging qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

title: General Manager
description:
**At Benihana, we take pride in our scratch kitchen concept, and we take pride in you!**


Benihana is an iconic brand and unique concept with over 55 years of combined history and stability.  

  

**In Exchange for your commitment, we offer:**


Competitive salary, plus two monthly bonus plans


FREE Shift Meals for you and your team | Meal Discounts


401K | PTO | Medical | Vision | Dental

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Responsible for the overall performance of restaurant operations including customer service, financials, food quality, beverage quality, guest, and employee safety practices.
* Oversee and coordinate the planning, organizing, training, and leadership necessary to achieve stated objectives in sales, costs, profitability, employee retention, guest service and satisfaction, food quality, cleanliness, and sanitation.
* Oversees all purchases of food, beverage, supplies, and equipment.
* Regularly measure and evaluate service levels and standards using guest and employee feedback and develop plans for continuous improvement.
* Ensures restaurant complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws, codes, and regulations.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* Three to five years of general management experience at a full-service, restaurant concept.
* Proficiency in food planning and preparation, purchasing, sanitation, security, personnel management, recordkeeping, and preparation of reports.
* Possess excellent basic math skills and have the ability to operate a POS system.
* Knowledge of computers (MS Word, Excel).
* Must possess a valid driver’s license where applicable.
* Must be eligible to work in the United States.
* Must agree to background and credit checks.
* ServSafe certified alcohol service certified preferred.
company_description: Create great guest memories, Come join our winning team! Benihana is the leading Asian-themed restaurant chain in the United States.

title: Project Manager
description:
Modicum is looking for a full-time project manager to join the accounts team at our creative agency. This role requires you to serve as the primary client contact for multiple projects of varying complexity, ensuring client satisfaction while removing roadblocks for your internal creative team. Your work will involve managing project scope, capacity, deadlines, meetings, and budgets in collaboration with a Creative Director and reporting to our VP of Accounts. You’re a great fit if you’re highly collaborative, don’t shy away from problem-solving opportunities, and genuinely enjoy “hopping on a call.” **A little bit about Modicum**
Modicum is an independent, tight-knit, creative collective. We use design thinking to help brands solve problems and work toward meaningful goals. We’ve earned the trust of major global brands through their most pivotal moments by immersing ourselves in their needs, crafting compelling stories, building intuitive tools, and designing unforgettable experiences.  

As an independent agency, we have the freedom to shed bureaucracy and dive head-first into the work. At Modicum, we’ve built a diverse, ego-free roster, and we believe in letting our team work how they work best—flexible, hybrid scheduling, direct access to clients, and a focus on nurturing rather than pigeonholing talent. We build genuine relationships with each other, give everyone a voice, and embrace work-life balance with predictable hours and PTO that’s actually O.  

Modicum celebrates diversity and is committed to an inclusive employee experience for all. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourage women, people of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply. We firmly believe the more inclusive we are, the better our team and work will be. To learn more, visit modicum.agency or check us out on Behance at behance.net/modicum
### **Duties + Responsibilities**

* Prepare and own timelines, budgets, and scopes of work for the success of creative services and work product for assigned clients
* Manage tactical progress of deliverables and produce client reports as required
* Identify, manage, and mitigate deadline, budget, and brand risks on projects
* Manage client and team expectations by facilitating frequent and effective team communication
* Provide project and client feedback that advocates for the client/agency relationship and furthers efficiency and quality of work
* Develop and manage financial forecasts, staffing and resource plans for near and long-term retainer and project work
* Participate in and help prepare new business pitches
* Manage $2-4MM in business

### **Qualifications**

* 5-7 years experience building and managing strong client relationships in project manager, project coordinator, or client services roles
* The desire to provide enthusiastic, friendly client experiences that go above and beyond nuts and bolts conversations
* The ability to set and negotiate expectations, anticipate internal team needs, and set creatives up for success (creative services knowledge is a plus!)
* Experience managing multiple concurrent tasks/projects across timelines, scopes, and budgets
* Excellent and timely communication skills, including the ability to compile, document, and communicate project requirements, resource plans, and calendar conflicts
* A highly organized nature and ability to adapt to agency-wide organizational systems
* A willingness to support the accounts and creative teams during off hours, when seasonal agency needs may necessitate an “all hands on deck” approach

**Pay + Perks**
Pay: $85,000 - $110,000 USD per year  

You’ll get the things you need, plus the balance you want:* Health, Dental, Vision, and FSA
* 401K and pre-tax commuter benefits
* Unlimited PTOSummer Fridays
* Long-term disability and life insurance
* Home office setup stipend
* Free Calm membership
* Computer buyback program
* Perks at Work discount program

  

Research shows that while men apply for jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other underrepresented groups tend to only apply when they check every box. So, if you think you have what it takes but don't necessarily meet every single point listed, please apply - you could be exactly who we are looking for!  

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, veteran status, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy status, sex, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, mental or physical disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected by law.  

Pursuant to the New York City Fair Chance Act, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. We here at Modicum will always respect pronouns and identities when addressing candidates who feel comfortable sharing theirs.  

Modicum celebrates diversity and is committed to an inclusive employee experience for all. We strongly encourage women, people of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply. We firmly believe the more inclusive we are, the better our team and work will be.

title: Product Operations Educator
description:
**Who We Are:**  

lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people.
  
  

**Job Summary:**  

Product Operations Educators are experts in organization and efficiency, executing inventory processing and other product operations, as directed and according to the company's standards. Product Operations Educators receive and process shipments, organize product within the store (the retail floor and the back of house) as directed, and complete other inventory-related tasks to maximize profitable product sell-through. Support guests on the retail floor by providing service or connecting the guest to another team member.
  
  

Core Responsibilities of the Job
  
  

* Organize and clean the inventory workspace to maximize efficiency and maintain a safe store environment.
* Execute inventory processing plan established by the Product Operations Lead, including accurate RFID inventory counts according to company standards.
* Receive and process product deliveries according to the company's standards, such as folding, sorting, and hanging product to optimize space and productivity.
* Reconcile, prepare, package, and ship product to appropriate locations according to company standards (e.g., damages, consolidations).
* Execute product display adjustments, daily restocking and destocking, or product moves on the floor according to company standards to maintain store organization and presentation.
* Execute market-relevant omnichannel programs (e.g., buy online/pickup in store and ship from store options) according to company standards.
* Interact with guests or facilitate connection with another team member to provide service on the retail floor and support the guest's experience.
* Contribute to a respectful and inclusive team environment to ensure a supportive and engaging experience for all team members and guests.
* Use in-store technology to support store operations and provide positive guest experiences.


Job Requirements
  
  

Eligibility
  
  

* Must be legally authorized to work in the country in which the store is located
* Must have the ability to travel to assigned store with reliable transportation methods
* Must be 18 years of age or older


Schedule/Availability
  
  

* The work schedule can vary based on store needs
* Shifts may be scheduled: evenings, overnights, mornings, afternoons, weekends, and holidays
* In addition, the schedule may include times when the store is closed to guests
* No Experience Required


Job Assets (i.e., nice to have; not required)
  
  

* Education: High school diploma/GED/equivalent, or above
* Experience (not necessarily the only focus of a role): retail, distribution center, or warehouse operations related (for example, stocking or inventory processing experience)


What We Look For
  
  

* Attention to Detail: Is careful about detail and thorough in completing work tasks
* Being Organized: Prioritizes and efficiently performs and completes assigned tasks
* Drive: Is self-motivated and determined to meet or exceed goals
* Safety Orientation: Is committed to complying with safety rules and guidelines
* Personal Responsibility: Accepts responsibility/accountability for actions; is dependable
* Inclusion & Diversity: Creates/supports an inclusive environment that values/celebrates differences
* Collaboration and Teamwork: Works productively with and supports others to achieve common goals; seeks connections, partnerships, and diverse perspectives
* Adaptability/Agility: Navigates uncertainty and ambiguity and can change priorities in a fast-paced environment; recovers quickly from setbacks


Work Context (e.g., environment, interactions, physical)
  
  

* Work involves moving through the store, sometimes on the sales floor with bright lights and loud music, and sometimes in areas with no windows or natural light
* Work is accomplished as part of a team, sometimes independently, and sometimes using a computer or other technology
* Work may involve moving boxes weighing up to 30 lbs (13.6 kg) or using ladders to reach materials


In keeping with our mission, please connect with us at accommodations@lululemon.com if you have questions about how your unique abilities may translate to the requirements for this role, with or without a reasonable accommodation. In your email, please include the position title, the location of the position and the nature of your question or request.
  
  

Compensation & Benefits Package
  
  

lululemon's compensation offerings are grounded in a pay-for-performance philosophy that recognizes exceptional team performance. The base pay range for this position is from $18.50- $21.29/hour subject to minimum wage in the location. The base pay offered is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. This position has a target bonus of an additional $3 per hour, subject to certain requirements and the Company's discretion, bringing the total target compensation range between $21.50- $24.29/ hour.
  
  

At lululemon, investing in our people is a top priority. We believe that when life works, work works. We strive to be the place where inclusive leaders come to develop and enable all to be well. Recognizing our teams for their performance and dedication, other components of our total rewards offerings include support of career development, wellbeing, and personal growth:
  
  

* Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans
* Paid time off
* Savings and retirement plan matching
* Generous employee discount
* Fitness & yoga classes
* Parenthood top-up
* Extensive catalog of development course offerings
* People networks, mentorship programs, and leadership series (to name a few)


**Note:** The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.
company_description: lululemon is a technical athletic apparel, footwear, and accessories company for yoga, running, training, and most other activities.

title: Assistant Store Manager, Junior
description:
The Junior Assistant Store Manager (ASM2) manages and supervises the Met Opera Shop at Lincoln Center and provides leadership and direction to the entire store team. The ASM2 must exude the excitement, professional presence, and confidence needed to protect and drive brand integrity.

Through leading company initiatives, the ASM2 ensures maximum productivity, profitability, operational excellence, and compliance with company procedures. The ASM2 is responsible for achieving daily, weekly, monthly and annual sales goals, adhering to personnel budgets, and executing on store merchandising, inventory, marketing, administrative tasks, and operational plans. This position will be responsible for ensuring all web, store shipments are processed and receiving completed daily.

This position reports to the store manager regarding personnel goals, store operations, merchandising for sales, inventory and merchandising goals
### **Primary Responsibilities**

* **Sales:**
* Achieves and implements sales plans
* Manages goals utilizing excel planning and budget tools
* Motivates and monitors staff to ensure daily sales goals are met
* Maintains strong presence on the selling floor
* Increases sales by identifying and acting upon sales opportunities including but not limited to performance schedules, tour groups, institutional sales, special sales, and in-store events
* Delivers consistent financial results through efficient store management
* Optimizes sales through adherence to merchandising standards
* Ensures available stock is always on the selling floor

* **Personnel**
* Under the direction of the SM, responsible for training and maintaining a diverse, knowledgeable and motivated sales team while managing all aspects of the physical store
* Supervises PT key associates ensuring clear communication and execution of all sales, personnel and operational plans
* Trains, coaches and motivates the team to deliver on sales goals, customer service principles, merchandising directions and operational standards of the Metropolitan Opera

* **Customer Service**
* Supervises customer service issues on selling floor in accordance with customer service guidelines
* As directed by the store manager, collaborates with other departments to provide a seamless customer service experience

* **Operations**
* Ensures adherence to all operational rules and guidelines including but not limited to opening, closing, cash handling, pricing, discounts, markdowns, special sales, member sales, restocking and merchandising
* Maintains selling floor
* Collaborates with SM and ASM1 to ensure smooth flow of merchandises from receiving to restocking to selling floor
* Adheres to merchandising standards
* Ensures all signs and communications are up to date and accurate
* Takes immediate action to correct any building maintenance or security issues
* Adheres to troubleshooting guidelines for POS and operations
* Reports discrepancies and POS problems to the SM and ASM1, following up as directed.
* Complies at all times with the standards and policies set out in the Metropolitan Opera Handbook.

### **Skills and Qualifications**

* Must have at least 2 to 5 years of retail management experience
* Hands-on management experience in fast paced retail store required
* Museum, music, or upper tier department stores preferred
* Exceptional customer service and communication skills
* College degree or relevant technical or vocational training preferred.
* Excellent math skills required
* Demonstrated foundation in Excel
* Must be skilled in leadership, coaching, and training, sales generation, strategic planning, authentic customer service, communication, conflict resolution, business acumen, time management, and POS and other retail software proficiency.
* Must be able to provide feedback, develop others, embrace and lead change, and make clear and defined decisions.
* Must have excellent interpersonal skills and be able act with integrity and professionalism to ensure that all business is conducted without bias or prejudice.
* Strong merchandising skills
* A solid knowledge of opera composers, performers, works and recordings preferred
* Love of opera welcomed

### **Physical Demands**

* Must be able to maneuver around sales floor and stock rooms, work with cleaning chemicals, and lift and carry up to 50 lbs
* Must be available to work a flexible schedule to meet the needs of the business
* Will take on other job responsibilities when needed

title: Trademark Paralegal
description:
**About Us:**


Conair is a leading international designer, manufacturer, and marketer of branded personal care and small kitchen appliances, cookware, hairbrushes & accessories, cosmetic bags, and travel accessories.

Conair has always been driven by a passion for innovation; it’s part of the Company’s DNA. Trendsetting products have been invented by Conair since its inception in 1959, keeping the Company always a step ahead of the competition. The company's domestic and international divisions offer a diversified mix of consumer and professional products sold in over 120 countries. The Family of Conair brands includes CONAIR, Cuisinart, Cuisinart Outdoors, BabylissPRO, Scünci, and Waring.

Conair’s passion for innovation gets stronger with each decade, as evidenced by the over 1,000 patents the Company has obtained worldwide. Today, Conair and its brands are names known throughout the world. Conair continues to introduce its brands to new and emerging markets, year after year. By the 1990s, most households in America owned at least one Conair product. Today many have more than one, and the Company’s goal is to ensure that every household in the world eventually owns one of our products.
At Conair, we inspire our customers with innovative high-quality products and
iconic brands that enhance their lives.**Position Summary:**
The Trademark Paralegal will work in the Company’s Legal Department under the supervision of the Chief Trademark Counsel and will liaise with personnel at all levels of the company throughout the world.
**Responsibilities**:
* Proficiency with Saegis software to conduct preliminary US and international screening searches.
* Ability to analyze trademark screening/search results and draft an analysis thereof.
* Knowledge of PATTSY (or similar docketing platform) and how to enter trademark filing deadlines and generate reports.
* Preparation of electronic filings for trademark applications and other trademark-related maintenance filings with the USPTO.
* Good communication skills and ability to instruct and liaise with foreign counsel on foreign applications, related maintenance filings and opposition proceedings.
* Coordination of the signing and legalization of POA’s and other documents. Notary public a plus.
* Ability to liaise with various marketing teams to gather product packaging, marketing and other materials for filings and litigation.
* Assist Chief Trademark Counsel and Chief Patent Counsel with anti-counterfeiting matters, including online brand protection, global customs recordals, coordinating attorney/law enforcement trainings, and other related activities.


Assist Chief Trademark Counsel with other intellectual property projects as needed.**Qualifications:**

* Minimum 3+ years experience, including substantial work experience with domestic and international searching, clearance, trademark filings, prosecution and docketing.
* Bachelor's Degree.
* Knowledge of and experience with Saegis, PATTSY, USPTO trademark website platform, Microsoft Outlook, Teams and Word.
* Must be detail-oriented, proactive, effective at multi-tasking, able to work well under pressure and to work independently as well as collaboratively.
* CPG industry work experience a plus, but not required.


In-house corporate experience preferred but not required.

**Environmental Factors:**

* Working conditions are normal for an office environment.
* Must be able to sit for extended periods of time.
* Must be able to use a computer keyboard and view a monitor for extended periods of time.
* Must be able to travel domestically and internationally for business (20% if needed)

**What we offer:**

* Comprehensive Medical/Dental/Vision plans
* Generous Paid Time Off Programs
* Life & Disability Insurance
* FSA/HRA/Dependent Care FSA
* Paid Parental Leave Policy
* 401k and company match
* EAP & Employee Wellness Programs
* Volunteer Days Paid Time Off
* Free Lunch in Stamford Office



As a team, we are passionate about building out our HR capabilities to continue being valuable partners to our business leaders and strong allies to our employees. If you are a dynamic and result oriented professional, we invite you to apply and make a meaningful impact on our brand's success. Conair is an equal opportunity employer, celebrating diversity and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Are you passionate about this opportunity but worried that you don’t have 100% of the experience we’re looking for? We still want to hear from you! Apply online and let us know why you would make a great addition to Conair!

title: Group Home Manager- Plainfield NJ
description:
**Position:** Residence Manager

**Location**: Plainfield NJ (Salem Rd.)

**S****hift:** **8am to 4pm Tuesdays to Saturday or Sunday to Thursday. Additional flexibility required based on home needs.**

**BENEFITS:** Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k (Up to 4% Match), Life Insurance, Flexible Spending Plan, 3-Weeks Paid Time Off, Paid Holidays, Employee Life Assistance Program, Access to Atlantic Federal Credit Union and NJM Insurance, Secure Advantage, Discount at Local Childcare Academy and ADP LifeMart.

**Seeking Manager with at least 2 years DDD Management Experience**. Following DDD and PILLARpolicies and procedures, and in accordance with expressed preferences and desires of individual residents, administers and supervises operation of a group living facility. The Residence Manager must cooperate with PILLAR, the Office of Licensing, the Division of Developmental Disabilities, and the Department of Human Services in any inspection or investigation.

**Essential Duties:**

* Supervising individual medical, activity, financial, and other recordkeeping and insures that required records and reports are completed and submitted according to requirements; serves as IHP coordinator for individuals who reside in the shared living facility.

* Performing functions of Residential Care Assistant or shift supervisor and supporting individuals in implementation of IHP/ISP or other goals and objectives.
* Adhering to standard health precautions and insuring wellbeing of residents by monitoring individual health and following up on medical, dental, and emotional health requirements, communication, social, recreation, and ADL skills, family/community functioning, and financial, training and habilitation needs; may accompany residents to appointments; may administer prescribed and over-the-counter medication.
* Maintaining safety and security by making periodic inspections, conducting fire drills according to schedules, enacting safety procedures, and training residents and staff; ensures that licensing standards are always maintained; conducts house meetings for residents and staff meetings for direct care employees.
* Hiring, directing, supervising, and training staff; coordinates staff schedules to coverage; conducts staff meetings; counsels and disciplines staff; evaluates staff performance and makes recommendation for compensation, promotion, transfer, or termination.
* Developing policies, guidelines and procedures based on experience and need; follows DDD and Pillarpolicies and procedures as described in Division Circulars, PillarPolicy Manual and PillarGroup Home Policy Manual to respond to and report about emergencies, incidents, operational breakdowns or other individual or systematic concerns in a timely manner; may conduct investigations regarding unusual incidents or issues relating to health, safety, or general welfare of residents.
* Taking lead role and participates in annual Licensing; participates in bi-annual Q&A audits and responds to findings with written plans of corrections.
* Maintaining ongoing communication with family, case managers and others; participates in case management conferences or other meetings relating to concerns of individuals; interacts with residents’ family members and friends and facilitates communications, coordinates activities with day program staff, professional consultants, representatives of other provider agencies; communicates with DDD staff as delegated by supervisor.
* Implementing annual operating budget for the residential facility; monitors and approves all budgetary expenditures; secures and accounts for personal funds of group home residents; assists residents with money management and ensures that individual funds expended as desired.
* Supervising upkeep of home in terms of safety, cleanliness, and comfort; coordinates maintenance and repair of home and all equipment; orders and maintains supplies as needed.

 **QUALIFICATIONS:**

* At least 21 years of age (Insurance Purposes)
* At least 2 years' DDD Management experience
* DDD Licensing experience preferred
* High school diploma or GED
	+ BA/BS degree in Social Service, Rehabilitation, LPN or similar discipline preferred.
* Valid driver’s license with 4 points or less always
* 3 years of successful employment working with adults with disabilities
* Ability to successfully complete Pillar trainings in required period and to adhere to DDD policies and procedures.
* Ability to drive a multi-passenger vehicle.
* Successful completion of drug screening, criminal history background and TB screening

  

8am to 4pm Tuesdays to Saturday or Sunday to Thursday.
  

Additional flexibility required based on home needs.

title: Lead Pharmacy Technician
description:
**InfuCare Rx** is a leading home infusion provider accredited by TJC, URAC and ACHC offering a specialized approach to caring for patients in need of IV therapy and specialty pharmacy services in the homecare setting. We have created an ethical, team oriented, and quality work environment for our employees that cultivates achievement and success. **Job Description**:
The Lead Pharmacy Technician reports to the Pharmacist in Charge. They will facilitate all phases of pharmacy compounding and dispensing while providing patient centric service to include regular interaction with Caregivers, Physicians, and other stakeholders during the execution of these functions. This person will always work under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist and in collaboration with the multi-disciplinary healthcare team to provide exceptional value to our customers. They will be a key contributor for all phases of the Specialty Infusion Pharmacy's operation and should be experienced in this segment of care delivery. The successful candidate will perform all duties in accordance with company policy and procedure, state professional standards, and other applicable regulatory requirements. They will contribute to the delivery of high standards of practice in all aspects of the service.  

Benefits:* Medical/Dental/Vision
* STD/LTD
* Group Term Life
* Voluntary Life and AD&D
* 401K with Company Match
* Paid Sick Leave
* Paid Time Off
* 6 Paid Holidays

 **General Duties:**
Under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist the Lead Pharmacy Technician will:* Supervise the day-to-day operations of InfuCare Rx Pharmacy Technicians at your local site; provide guidance and support to pharmacy technicians located throughout the enterprise.
* Performs a variety of duties and technical tasks structured to assist the pharmacist, patients, and other healthcare providers. These tasks are all designed to support the medication distribution system for InfuCare Rx patients.
* Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications and maintaining personal networks.
* Have the ability to organize and prioritize workload.
* Serves and protects the Pharmacy by adhering to professional standards, company policies and procedures, federal, state, and local requirements, and URAC, TJC, ACHC standards of care.
* Assist the pharmacist with the preparation and dispensing of medications and supplies using appropriate techniques.
* Perform basic pharmaceutical calculations in order to obtain correct dose of medication
* Demonstrate and incorporate principles of safety, sterile product processing and infection control into daily activities as outlined in organization's policies and procedures.
* Dispense products and record in pharmacy management software to generate delivery documents for prescription including ticket and labels.
* Ensure that a licensed pharmacist on duty properly checks all outgoing prescriptions prior to delivery and participates in patient outreach process.
* Assist with the selection, packing and delivery of specialty infusion products and services on a patient specific basis.
* Contact patients, caregivers, and other stakeholders to determine health, supplies or delivery matters and as needed.
* Confirm delivery based on company protocols.
* Assist with recording and maintaining of various pharmacy logs.
* Ensure that all pharmacy, preparation, and all surfaces are maintained in accordance with company policies and regulatory requirements.
* Assists with product purchasing, inventory, and equipment management.
* Coordinate with suppliers and ensure the correct drug products are received from the wholesale company if requested.
* Verify the accuracy of product orders received. Checks prices against contract and in the schedule of charges. Assists with the system of tracking infusion pumps and medical equipment.
* Perform other duties and tasks as assigned by supervisor.

 **Minimum Education, Certification and Experience/Skill Requirements:*** High School diploma or equivalent.
* A Pharmacy Technician License in state of employment is required.
* Minimum of (2) years’ experience as a Pharmacy technician in a compounding pharmacy preferred, where applicable.
* Minimum of (2) years’ experience as a pharmacy technician preferred.
* Excellent oral and written communication, interpersonal, and resource management skills.
* Ability to manage complex and changing calendars.
* Ability to interact effectively and courteously with individuals of diverse cultural backgrounds.
* Ability to work independently and meet established or anticipated deadlines.
* Ability to take on a wide range of duties and projects and prioritize appropriately.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality in all work performed.
* Experience providing customer service to internal and external customers, including meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.
* Basic proficiency in Microsoft Word and Microsoft Excel.
* Ability to compound, prepare and dispense medications/supplies including clean room maintenance.
* Ability to record and maintain pharmacy records. Understand how to calculate and check for correct doses of medication.
* Create a safe and professional environment.
* Ability to oversee the completion of tasks of a team of Technicians and train individuals where needed.

 **Highly Preferred Certification and Experience/Skill Requirements:*** Experience working in an acute or specialty infusion pharmacy
* Experience working in a hospital pharmacy
* Experience with advanced sterile compounding, (Chemo, TPN, Antibiotics plus other complex therapies)
* Experience with CPR+ Pharmacy Management System
* Completion of an accredited Pharmacy Technician training program certified as a Certified Pharmacy Technician (CPhT - Pharmacy Tech Certification Board or ICPhT - Institute for the Certification of Pharmacy)

 **Physical Demands:**
Required to stand, walk, sit, talk, and hear; required to use hands to operate vehicles and office equipment; must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 lbs; specific vision requirements for this job include: close, distance and peripheral vision, and the ability to adjust focus, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position without compromising patient care.  

InfuCare Rx is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, military status, marital status, citizenship/immigration status, sex (including pregnancy and relation conditions, sexual orientation, or gender identity), age (40 and older), disability, genetic information (including employer requests for, or purchase use, or disclosure of genetic tests, genetic services, or family medical history), retaliation for filing a charge, reasonably opposing discrimination, or participating in a discrimination lawsuit, investigation, or proceeding. Background checks and drug screens are part of our hiring process. Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran.

title: Pricing Strategy & Operations Analyst
description:
StubHub is on a mission to redefine the live event experience on a global scale. Whether someone is looking to attend their first event or their hundredth, we’re here to delight them all the way from the moment they start looking for a ticket until they step through the gate. The same goes for our sellers. From fans selling a single ticket to the promoters of a worldwide stadium tour, we want StubHub to be the safest, most convenient way to offer a ticket to the millions of fans who browse our platform around the world.  

Our Business Development team is looking for a skilled pricing and operations analyst with experience in dynamic ticket pricing for live events. Our team develops partnerships across the live events value chain with sports teams, leagues, concert promoters, festival organizers, and other rights holders and venues. This person will play a critical role on the team, using historical data, market trends, and knowledge of live events to help StubHub’s partners optimize yield. **This role can be based out of our Los Angeles, CA, New York, NY, or Washington DC office and has a hybrid (3 in-person days per week) work schedule.**
### **What You'll Do**

* Using in-house and third-party tools to manage and distribute live events tickets in accordance with defined pricing strategies and broader business objectives
* Setting and evaluating ticket pricing and distribution strategies across a range of live event types to maximize yield while managing risk
* Analyzing historical transaction data and monitoring live events trends (e.g., weather, performance, etc.) to inform pricing decisions
* Assisting with periodic internal and external sales and partnership reporting, as needed
* Tracking yield performance, defining key metrics, and preparing periodic reports for leadership

### **What You've Done**

* 1+ years of related work experience
* Demonstrated work experience pricing and distributing live events tickets via secondary marketplaces
* Ability to read primary and secondary market trends in order to make adjustments
* Understanding P&L reporting and how this will affect decisions
* Identifying broadcasting strategies to ensure we have the probability to selling to each type of buyer but ensuring not to saturating the market
* Experience using sales data to inform pricing and/or yield forecasting
* Deep familiarity with the US sports landscape and knowledge of the live events ecosystem, including ticket resale marketplaces
* Ability to perform quick math and strong problem solving and critical thinking
* Proven track record with being a trusted, reliable team member
* Flexibility of scheduling

### **What We Offer**

* **Accelerated Growth Environment:** Immerse yourself in an environment designed for swift skill and knowledge enhancement, where you have the autonomy to lead experiments and tests on a massive scale.
* **Top Tier Compensation Package:** Enjoy a rewarding compensation package that includes enticing stock incentives, aligning with our commitment to recognizing and valuing your contributions.
* **Flexible Time Off:** Embrace a healthy work-life balance with unlimited Flex Time Off, providing you the flexibility to manage your schedule and recharge as needed.
* **Comprehensive Benefits Package:** Prioritize your well-being with a comprehensive benefits package, featuring 401k, and premium Health, Vision, and Dental Insurance options.
* **Team-Building Events:** Engage in vibrant team events that foster camaraderie and collaboration, creating an atmosphere where your professional and personal growth are celebrated.


The anticipated gross base annual salary range for this role is $79,100 - $99,950 per year. Actual compensation will vary depending on factors such as a candidate’s qualifications, skills, experience, and competencies. Base annual salary is one component of StubHub’s total compensation and competitive benefits package, which includes equity, 401(k), paid time off, paid parental leave, and comprehensive health benefits.  

California Job Applicant Privacy Notice found here **About Us**
StubHub is the world’s leading marketplace to buy and sell tickets to any live event, anywhere. Through StubHub in North America and viagogo, our international platform, we service customers in 195 countries in 33 languages and 49 available currencies. With more than 300 million tickets available annually on our platform to events around the world - from sports to music, comedy to dance, festivals to theater - StubHub offers the safest, most convenient way to buy or sell tickets to the most memorable live experiences. Come join our team for a front-row seat to the action. **We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity on our team. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.**

title: Pricing Strategy & Operations Manager
description:
StubHub is on a mission to redefine the live event experience on a global scale. Whether someone is looking to attend their first event or their hundredth, we’re here to delight them all the way from the moment they start looking for a ticket until they step through the gate. The same goes for our sellers. From fans selling a single ticket to the promoters of a worldwide stadium tour, we want StubHub to be the safest, most convenient way to offer a ticket to the millions of fans who browse our platform around the world.  

Our Business Development team is looking for a skilled data analyst with experience in dynamic ticket pricing for live events. Our team develops partnerships across the live events value chain with sports teams, leagues, concert promoters, festival organizers, and other rights holders and venues. This person will play a critical role on the team, using historical data and market trends in conjunction with knowledge of consumer behavior, live events, and ticket marketplaces to help StubHub’s partners optimize yield. **This role can be based out of our Los Angeles, CA, New York, NY or Washington DC, office and has a hybrid (3 in-person days per week) work schedule.**
### **What You'll Do**

* Using in-house and third-party tools to manage and distribute live events tickets in accordance with defined pricing strategies and broader business objectives

* Monitoring trends in live events, yield, ticket marketplaces, and consumer behavior to inform pricing strategies

* Tracking yield performance, defining key metrics, and preparing periodic reports for leadership
* Collaborating with analytics, engineering, and data science teams to refine pricing and distribution tools

### **What You've Done**

* Ability to read primary and secondary trends in order to make adjustments
* Understanding P&L reporting and this will affect decisions

* Proven track record with being a trusted, reliable team member

title: Associate Director, Multicultural Planning
description:
**Opportunity**: We are seeking a seasoned, multicultural media expert who has established industry connections, with an opportunity to grow their network. This individual thrives in a dynamic environment, excels at building consensus, and is dedicated to driving impactful brand results. In this role, the Associate Director will craft tailored multicultural media initiatives designed with business outcomes in mind. They will be responsible for building trust with clients and seamless collaboration with the Interagency Team (IAT) for delivering successful brand and media outcomes in our clients' multicultural initiatives.**Your Skills**:* Strategic mindset with a knack for brand-building
* Comprehensive knowledge of the multicultural media landscape
+ Passionate about reaching multicultural audiences
+ Established connections with media partners

* Well-versed in all media channels, with a versatile background in planning within the gaming, entertainment, and sports industries
* Proactive and eager with a deep commitment to producing impactful, award-winning work that elevates the team, multicultural initiatives, and garners recognition for our clients
* Proficient in leveraging data to craft compelling narratives
* Excellent client service capabilities
* A solution-focused, team collaborator
* Proficient at managing relationships at all levels within the organization
* An inventive thinker who excels in collaborative settings
* Adaptable to evolving environments and matrixed decision-making structures
* Possesses a strong sense of urgency

**Your Responsibilities**:* Leads the strategic direction and oversees multicultural planning initiative in collaboration with internal strategy and investment, in addition to external client and agency teams
+ Includes day-to-day work, along with big ideas across gaming, the metaverse, etc.
+ Manages budget details internally and externally

* Creates all content for presentations and client reviews
+ Strategic plan recommendations
+ Thought Leadership and POVs

* IAT point of contact for multicultural initiatives across planning, internal teams, and external stakeholders–includes clients and agency partners (creative, PR, and sponsorships)
* Works in partnership with the Operations lead and leadership team to establish and maintain processes that facilitate exceptional work
* Reports to a Group Account Director and helps support/deliver vision for the brand

**Your Qualifications**:* 7-8 years of media planning experience with a focus on crafting culture-first media opportunities for diverse audiences, including African American/Black, Hispanic/Latino, LGBTQ+ communities
+ Previous agency experience strongly preferred

* Highly skilled in infusing creativity, cutting-edge ideas, and the latest industry trends into media planning projects
* Track record of crafting compelling media plans and narratives that resonate with senior clients, effectively guiding their high-level media strategy decisions and executions
* Exhibits clear, diplomatic communication skills, especially when addressing complex or sensitive questions from clients or internal teams
* Can maintain strong media partner relationships
* Detail-oriented and proven ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
* Demonstrates an ability to be curious and passionate about our client’s business
* Ability to work across both Google Workspace & Microsoft 365


The base salary for this position at the time of this posting may range from $75,000 to $180,000. Individual compensation varies based on job-related factors, including business needs, experience, level of responsibility and qualifications. We offer a competitive benefits package, please visit https://www.wpp.com/people/wellbeing/benefits-at-wpp-in-the-us for more details.

title: IN HOME RN
description:
**Job Title:** Registered Nurse (RN)

**Salary:** $45/hour

**Position Type:** Full-time/Part-time

**Job Description:**


We are looking for a compassionate and dedicated Registered Nurse (RN) to care for our infant in our home. This position involves caring for a cute baby requiring bipap support and enteral feeds in a low acuity setting. The ideal candidate will be experienced, patient, and loving, with a strong commitment to providing high-quality care to pediatric patients.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Provide nursing care to a pediatric patient on bipap and enteral feeds.
* Monitor vital signs and overall health status of the patient.
* Administer medications and treatments as prescribed by the physician.
* Ensure a safe and nurturing environment for the patient.
* Document all nursing assessments, interventions, and outcomes in the patient’s medical record.
* Respond promptly to any changes in the patient’s condition.

**Qualifications:**

* Prior nursing experience, preferably in pediatrics.
* Experience with bipap and enteral feeding preferred.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively within a healthcare team.
* Passion for caring for children and their families.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive hourly wage of $55.
* Flexible scheduling options.

title: Transporter
description:
**Main Function:**  

The dialysis transporter provides safe, timely and courteous transport to and from the nursing home to the dialysis center.
  
  

Performs in accordance with the established rules, regulations and operating standards of the facility.
  
  

Abides by all Federal, State and local regulations and laws relating to the operation of an ESRD facility as well as ensuring patient confidentiality.
  
  

**Specific Duties:**  

Transports patients from the nursing home to the dialysis center
  
  

assures the chair being used for transport is clean and good working order
  
  

verifies patient scheduled treatment time and picks up patients timely
  
  

brings along patients interfacility communication book and assures entry from floor
  
  

places patient in available station as directed by clinical staff
  
  

when notified by clinical staff of completion of treatment, return patient to floor nursing home
  
  

Returns patient to floor with their communications book after entry made by dialysis staff
  
  

Additional Duties
  
  

Assist with faxing, filing and copies
  
  

Daily stocking the unit, checking inventory , ordering, deliveries, store incoming deliveries, stocking items in an organized first in first out form
  
  

Housekeeping
  
  

Assist with cleaning and disinfection of chairs and equipment
  
  

**Relationships:**  

Keeps the Nurse Manager or charge nurse informed of any unusual patient problems or complications.
  
  

Keeps the Nurse Manager or charge nurse informed of the operational status of all equipment on an on-going basis.
  
  

Respects the confidentiality of all patients.
  
  

Maintains a professional and functional attitude with co- workers in the presence of patients and others.
  
  

Maintains a cooperative working relationship with all co-workers, both intrafacility and interfacility with patients and with others whom a contact is made.
  
  

Willfully assists in the orientation and teaching of new employees and students.
  
  

Maintains established Standards of Caring Behavior.
  
  

**Physical, Emotional and Sensory Requirements:**  

Must be able to cope with mental and emotional stress of the position.
  
  

Must function independently, have flexibility, personal integrity and the ability to work effectively with the patients, staff, family members, visitors and support regulatory agencies.
  
  

Must be in good general health and demonstrate emotional stability.
  
  

Must demonstrate a caring attitude and be able to relate to and work with the ill, disabled, elderly, emotionally upset, and at time hostile people within the facility.
  
  

Must adhere to dress code and maintain a high level of personal hygiene and cleanliness.
  
  

Ability to read, write, understand and speak English .
  
  

Must have communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with a wide variety of individuals
  
  

**Standards Of Caring Behavior:**  

On all occasions, to approach the patients, families and all visitors in a courteous, friendly manner with respect to their rights and concerns.
  
  

To reduce patients, families and visitors anxieties by introducing self, explaining the process and possible delays in schedule, orienting them to the facility, and maintaining a neat, professional appearance.
  
  

To converse with patients and their families to ascertain any specific problems that need attention
  
**and refers them to appropriate sources when indicated:** i.e. Physician, Administrator, Nurse, Dietitian and Social Worker.
  
  

In general, demonstrates Caring Behaviors through making eye contact, smiling, initiating conversation and sharing a genuine concern for the situation.
  
  

**Minimum Qualifications: Education and Training Requirements:**  

Good communications skills – verbal and written
  
  

Required to move dialysis transport chairs with patients seated and may lift chemical and water solutions of up to 30 lbs. up as high as 5 feet.

title: Porter/Housekeeping Aide
description:
Our residents hold a special place as cherished members of our extended family.



Choosing a dependable team of caregivers, committed to their promises, is a significant and difficult life decision for any family. As a collective, we take pride in being a sanctuary where individuals in our community can discover compassionate support along their health journey. As a **Porter/Housekeeping Aide** on our team, you will make a meaningful impact on the lives of our extended family. In turn, we are dedicated to ensuring our team of caregivers feel the same compassion provided to the residents.


If any part of this message resonates with you, then **Complete Care at Wall** wants to hear from you!


**Porter/Housekeeping Aide** Qualifications & Responsibilities:


* High School Diploma or equivalent
* Experience in long term care and environmental services preferred but not required
* Provide cleaning services for business offices, rehab gym, interior and exterior public and common areas and amenities of the facility in a safe, neat, clean and attractive condition
* Maintains the facility by cleaning, dusting, vacuuming, and polishing
* Keeping equipment operating by following operating instructions; troubleshooting breakdowns; maintaining supplies; performing preventive maintenance; calling for repairs
* Reports potentially unsafe conditions promptly to the Supervisor
* Maintain all grounds; including sidewalks, public walkways and stairways, building exteriors, garden areas in a neat, clean and attractive condition.Keeping supplies ready by restocking housekeeping supplies; ordering new supplies as needed
* Wash/dry, fold, sort and label clean linens
* Follow a daily routine and weekly schedules
* Interact with residents, families, and visitors in a friendly and courteous manner
* Completing tasks such as dusting, vacuuming, mopping in resident areas
* Removing trash from common areas and resident rooms
* Other duties assigned by supervisor


**Porter/Housekeeping Aide** Schedules & Benefits:


* Schedule: Full-time, Part-time, & Per Diem opportunities on all shifts, with rotating weekend requirement
* Health, dental, vision and PTO for full-time employees
* Daily Pay Option
* Opportunities for advancement


**Complete Care at Wall** is an equal opportunity employer.

**Unit Manager, RN/LPN Responsibilities**:

title: Director of Housekeeping
company: Atlantic Coast Rehabilitation and Healthcare Center
description:
**Atlantic Coast Healthcare and Rehabilitation located in Lakewood NJ is looking for a Full Time Director of Housekeeping.**


**Salary range 55,000-65,000**


* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance


**Duties and Responsibilities****:**

  


* Ensures compliance with government and accrediting agency standards and regulations pertaining to Housekeeping and Laundry.


* Analyzes and evaluates all Housekeeping programs, policies and procedures.


* With consent of the Administrator, revises policies, procedures and programs as needed to improve department functions and to ensure the department in meeting the needs of the residents, their families, the facility, staff and regulatory agencies.


* Develops; implements and monitors systems for Housekeeping/Laundry documentation and record keeping necessary to maintain accountability and compliance with federal and state regulations and facility policies.


* Participates in facility surveys (inspections) made by authorized government agencies.


* Develops and maintains project schedules for daily, monthly, and other frequencies as required for cleaning and floor care needs.


* Reviews and develops a plan of correction of housekeeping deficiencies noted during survey inspections and provides a written copy of such to the administrator.


* Attends administrative staff meetings and other facility meetings related to the provision of quality Housekeeping programs.


* With the other department heads, plans and coordinates employee safety and security activities, keeping abreast of all local, City, State and Federal guidelines concerning department activities.


* Assists the Infection Control Coordinator in identifying, evaluating, and classifying routine and job-related Housekeeping functions to ensure that tasks involving the potential exposure to blood/body fluids are properly identified and recorded.


* Keeps abreast of economic conditions/situations and recommends to the Administration adjustments in Housekeeping Services that assure the continued ability to provide a clean, safe and comfortable environment.


* Makes daily rounds and record findings to assure that housekeeping personnel are performing required duties and to assure that appropriate housekeeping procedures are being rendered to meet the needs of the facility.

  


**Duties and Responsibilities (continued)****:**

  


* Maintains a productive working relationship with other department supervisors and coordinates housekeeping/laundry services to assure that care and services can be performed without interruption.


* Oversees the maintenance of the general plant and facility in a safe, clean and orderly environment.


* Develops, maintains, and implements infection control and universal precautions, policies and procedures to assure that the sanitary environment is maintained at all times and that aseptic and isolation techniques are followed by all Housekeeping personnel.


* Adheres to established budget parameters.


* Delegates a responsible staff member to act on your behalf when you are absent, or as otherwise needed.


* Reviews and checks competence of housekeeping personnel and make necessary adjustments/corrections as required or that may become necessary.


* Establishes an orientation program for new Housekeeping/Laundry staff in order to facilitate their assimilation into the work place within a reasonable time span and to ensure that each staff member understands his/her role responsibilities and standards of performances


* Supervises daily operations so that all standards are met.


* Ensures staff is organized to accomplish required activities in an efficient and timely manner.


* Completes written performances evaluations on the staff following probation and thereafter annually and when otherwise necessitated


* Initiates corrective disciplinary action, as needed


* Ensures that Housekeeping/Laundry personnel follow established safety regulations in the use of equipment and supplies at all times


* become necessary.


* Assumes the administrative authority, responsibility, and accountability of directing the Housekeeping Department.

  



Oversees the delivery of quality Housekeeping services.
* Ensures that Housekeeping schedules are followed as outlined for respective shift or area.


* Coordinates daily Housekeeping services with nursing services when performing routine assignment in resident living areas.


* Maintains general facility grounds and equipment in a safe, clean and orderly environment.


* Keeps Work area(s) free of hazardous conditions i.e. grease/oil, spills, excess supplies, equipment etc; to ensure that all established safety rules/regulations are followed at all times.


* Reports all unsafe hazardous conditions, defective equipment, etc. to the Director of Maintenance.


* Ensures that established infection control and universal precaution practices are maintained when performing Housekeeping procedures. (e)

  



Oversees Housekeeping supplies and equipment.
* Ensures that an adequate supply of housekeeping supplies is maintained in utility/janitorial closets to perform daily tasks.

  


**Duties and Responsibilities (continued)****:**

  


* Monitors housekeeping procedures to ensure that supplies are used in an efficient manner to avoid waste.


* Ensures that equipment is cleaned and properly stored at the end of the shift.

  



Directly supervises Housekeeping management and housekeeping department staff.
* Establishes an orientation program for new Housekeeping staff in order to facilitate their assimilation into the work place within a reasonable time span arid to ensure that each staff member understands his/her role, responsibilities and standards of performances.


* Completes written performance evaluations on the staff following probation and thereafter annually, and when performance dictates the need.


* Initiates corrective disciplinary action, as needed.


* Creates and maintains an atmosphere of warmth, personal interest, and positive emphasis, as well as a calm environment throughout the facility.


* Supervises daily operations so that all standards are met arid schedules maintained.


* Ensures staff are organized to accomplish regarded activities in anefficient and timely manner


* Maintains adequate staffing levels.

  



Participates in Quality Assurance/Performance improvement programs.
* Participates in QA/PI meetings


* Develops, implements, reviews and revises QA/PI activities within the Housekeeping Department.


* Performs daily inspection of work tasks performed by staff and records results on Quality Assurance Inspection forms.

  



Participates in and adhere to employee health, safetyand security programs and activities.
* Conducts all activities within established safety, security and infection control procedures and guidelines.


* Operates equipment and machinery in accordance with manufacturers’ directions and facility procedures.


* Receives annual physical including appropriate screening for tuberculosis.


* Corrects unsafe or hazardous condition encountered, if unable to correct, reports condition to Housekeeping Director upon discovery.


* Responds to fire/disaster drills and emergencies.


* Reports all accident and incidents to supervisor immediately upon occurrence.

  


**Duties and Responsibilities (continued)****:**

  


* Observes and responds to all standing facility security precautions,



devices and alerts as they pertain to work and common area.
* Cooperates with investigations regarding employee health, safety programs and security programs.

  



Participates In mandatory in-service and Jab training programs.
* Attends mandatory in-service, annually.


* Attends in-service, workshops and seminars to further professional development.


* Ensures that the department staff attends mandatory in-services annually.


* Encourages the department staff to attend in-services workshops and seminars to further professional development.


* Maintains a high level of industry knowledge and keep Administration aware of changes in the industry.

  



Other related duties and activities as may become necessary or as directed by the Administrator or designee.

  


**Job Conduct****:**


* The ability to come to work regularly and promptly


* Comply with departmental dress code.


* The ability to maintain normal, reasonable levels of personal hygiene and professional appearance.


* The ability to get along with co-workers, subordinates, supervisors, clients, members of the public, vendors and consultants, and/or anyone within facility in a professional manner, demonstrating courtesy, respect and cooperation.

title: Director of Development
description:
Reporting to the Head of School, the Director of Development will plan, implement and oversee the organization’s advancement efforts, including major gift, annual fund, endowment and capital campaigns. He or she will create and formalize an engagement strategy for parents, grandparents, alumni, and stakeholders of Manhattan Day School (MDS).  



The Director of Development will work closely with lay leaders and appropriate administrators to devise and formulate plans and then implement them. He or she will need excellent communication skills, both written and verbal as well as the ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and volunteers. Since this may be a one person operation, the ability to bring in and work with partners will be very important.  



Responsibilities include the following:* Creation and execution of strategic plan for development and alumni and grandparent/family relations efforts for MDS including setting realistic and measurable goals.
* Identify, cultivate, solicit, and steward individual donors, for expendable as well as capital and endowment gifts.
* Responsible for managing all development activities for the Head of School.
* Drive strategy and planning for events; including but not limited to:
+ Annual fundraising dinner, the selection and solicitation of honorees, overseeing logistics of the dinner, and working with relevant volunteer committees; and
+ Cultivation events, including parlor meetings with major stakeholders, grandparent events and alumni programming.

* Work with School’s leadership and Board members, including jointly staffing the board, parent’s council, and engaging lay leaders around development activities.
* Create strategy for and execute any future comprehensive/capital campaigns for MDS.
* Working with appropriate staff and lay leaders, and spearhead the selection and implementation of a Contact Relationship Management database.

  


Salary commensurate with experience in the range of $130,000 - $150,000.

If interested, please send resume and cover letter to resumes@manhattanday.org

title: Recreation Aide/Driver
description:
Our residents hold a special place as cherished members of our extended family.



Choosing a dependable team of caregivers, committed to their promises, is a significant and difficult life decision for any family. As a collective, we take pride in being a sanctuary where individuals in our community can discover compassionate support along their health journey. As a **Recreation Aide/Driver** on our team, you will make a meaningful impact on the lives of our extended family. In turn, we are dedicated to ensuring our team of caregivers feel the same compassion provided to the residents.



If any part of this message resonates with you, then we want to hear from you at **Complete Care at Whispering Woods!**


**Recreation Aide/Driver** Qualifications and Responsibilities:


* High School Diploma or equivalent
* BA in Recreation/Psychology/CTRS preferred but not required
* Experience in long term care and Recreation preferred
* Positive and energetic individual with creativity
* Ability to work independently or part of a group
* Must have a valid driver’s license
* Experience driving a 15 passenger bus
* Safely transport residents to and from medical appointments, social activities, and other destinations
* Assist residents in and out of the vehicle, ensuring their safety and comfort
* Maintain the cleanliness and maintenance of the vehicle
* Follow all traffic laws and safety regulations
* Provide companionship and support to residents during transportation
* Communicate effectively with nursing home staff regarding residents' schedules and needs
* Keep accurate records of trips, mileage, and any incident
* Report any vehicle maintenance issues to the appropriate personnel
* Other duties as assigned by supervisor


**Recreation Aide/Driver** Schedule and Benefits:
* Schedule: Per Diem: Tues/Thurs 9a-3p, & every other weekend 10a-3p


* Daily Pay Available


* Health, dental, vision and PTO for full time employees.


* Opportunities for advancement


**Complete Care at Whispering Woods** is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Program Manager
description:
### **Project Management**


**New York, NY**

#### **About the job**


* Leads the PMO on the account, develops clear vision/standards and champions the use of best practices, standards and processes.
* Provides leadership to the project teams, builds relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.
* Support of growth on existing clients – facilitation of estimation, high level planning, scope/assumptions and cross discipline collaboration.
* Solid understanding of client's business, needs, expectations and requirements.
* Collaboration with project teams on approach, deliverables, dependencies, schedules and tools.
* Responsible for program health, consistency across program, program level status reporting, program meetings/ceremonies, change control process, program governance.
* Management of overall program timeline and dependencies, program financial reporting, risk management, conflict resolution, stakeholder management.
* Key point of contact for all day-to-day program related issues/escalations.
* Team management, onboarding, staffing.
* Manages moderate complexity programs with multiple workstreams or projects.
* Manages client budgets of ~5M.
* Any other reasonable or necessary activity required by management or leadership.


#### **Qualifications**


* Bachelor's Degree
* 1-3 years of program management, 5-7 years of project management experience, preferably in a digital environment
* Proven understanding of standard project/program methodologies
* Experience creating and managing project timelines and monitoring budgets, experience working with clients and within scopes of work
* Remote position with the ability to travel, as needed


You will report to the Program Director

  


#### **Additional Information**


The anticipated salary range for this position is $94,000 - $152,375. Actual salary will be based on a variety of factors including relevant experience, knowledge, skills and other factors permitted by law. A range of medical, dental, vision, 401(k) matching, paid time off, and/or other benefits also are available. For more information regarding dentsu benefits, please visit dentsubenefitsplus.com

Provides various support functions at multiple levels for the claims department. Maintains a solid understanding of AmTrust’s mission, vision, and values. Upholds the standards of the AmTrust organization.
Responsibilities:
* Create and submit EDI First Report of Injury and Subsequent Reports in our EDI programs to be
* Research Workers Compensation Claims in applicable claim system for information needed to complete EDI reports. This would include reviewing the claim and determining what information needs to be reported based on the State requirements.
* Review state websites for filing information, potential penalties or fines. Analyze any EDI errors and make necessary corrections as stipulated by the state requirements.
* Complies all data using state EDI reporting requirements and time frames.
* Remain current on EDI rules and requirements, as well as IAIABC release updates.
* Role will typically be dedicated to specific state forms generation
* Communicate with claims adjusting staff regarding missing necessary EDI filing data.


Qualifications:

Required:* High school diploma
* Minimum 1 year experience working in insurance claims department OR related office environment
* Basic understanding of business technology, including MS Office, claims financial and imaging system.
* Basic knowledge of insurance as it relates to a Claims Department and claims processes
* Ability to take direction and make decisions.
* Good verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to establish goals and meet deadlines
* Self-organized and detail oriented.
* Ability to work well under pressure and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to work in a team environment.
* Ability to learn new procedures and adapt to a changing environment.
* Professional telephone demeanor and good oral and written communication skills.

  

Preferred:* Some college or Insurance related course preferred

  

Degree of Supervision Required:* Supervision will be needed during the initial stages of employment and with the introduction of any new job tasks or responsibilities, as well as some resource support to handle questions/issues that arise during the normal course of business.
* Minimal supervision is needed during the normal course of business.
